loans.name: Ana Felicita

texts.es: Ana de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 1 años de edad que es su mayor alegría y la razón de tanto esfuerzo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a elaborar y posteriormente vender tamales de gallina actividad que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de sus productos, por su excelente sabor y precio accesible. Ana desea reparar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado, antes del próximo invierno.
texts.en: Ana, 28 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and her small daughter, 1 year old, who is her greatest joy and the reason for such effort. She is an enterprising woman who works making and selling chicken tamales, work that she has done for a long time, for which she has a great number of customers who like her products for their excellent flavor and accessible price. Ana wants to repair the roof on her house, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to replace the roof on her house, since it is deteriorated, before the upcoming winter.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Nyarukamba A Power Of God Twanzane Group.

texts.en:
Harriet is a member of Nyarukamba A Power of God Twanzane Group who has a business of growing Irish potatoes, peas and garlic and at the same time earns a salary from the local government. She is facing hardships of low market prices, unpredictable weather changes and customers who delay  paying her. However, she has future plans of starting up her own school. 

Harriet has asked for a loan to buy garlic seeds and peas for planting.

loans.use: to buy garlic seeds and peas for planting

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para sus 2 hijos, inicio con un negocio de barbería prestando su servicio en su casas o a domicilio en el municipio de Medellín, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

El trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupado en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitado por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de cuchillas, gel, e instrumentos de trabajo que le hacen falta.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Daniel a continuar con su proyecto de vida!

es un prestamo
texts.en:
Daniel, in his untiring search for a better life and better economic stability for his 2 children, began with a barber business offering his services in the homes of the municipality of Medellín, a municipality where drive and tenacity are a very important model for the inhabitants in this zone. 

He works every day with hours that vary a lot, and is always busy in some service since he is requested a lot for his good work. 

He asks for economic support to purchase razor blades, gel, and work tools that he lacks. 

These days, he is happy for the good work that he has done to date and that it has permitted him to enjoy a more stable job. 

With a loan you will be able to support Daniel in continuing his life project!

loans.use: to purchase razor blades, gel, and work tools to update his shaving machine.

loans.name: Nora Ceneyda

texts.es:
Nora una persona emprendedora desde siempre, quien ha emprendido varios negocios con el fin de encontrar una sostenibilidad económica y sobre todo poder dedicar su tiempo a sus 3 hijos, está incursionando en el mundo de la belleza con sus servicios a domicilios de cepillado, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas, etc. Con el cual ha generado ingresos para sostener su hogar.

Espera crecer mucho más su negocio, en un futuro poder tener su propio local de belleza y posicionarse en el mercado de un forma segura.
Su dificultad más grande es el transporte tan complicado en la ciudad.

El crédito será utilizado para adquirir los muebles, equipos y productos de belleza (maquillaje, plancha, sprays, cremas de peinar, etc.) con los que podrá ofrecer un servicio de mejor calidad y con su toque característico
texts.en:
Nora has always been an enterprising person, who has undertaken various businesses with the end of finding economic sustainability and, above all, to be able to spend time with her 3 children. She is entering the world of beauty with her services in people's houses of hair-styling, makeup, nail care, etc. with which she she has generated income to sustain her household. 

She hopes to grow her business a lot, in the future to be able to have her own beauty salon and position herself securely in the market. Her greatest difficulty is the transportation which is so challenging in the city. 

The loan will be used to purchase furniture, equipment, and beauty products (make up, hair straighteners, sprays, styling creams, etc.) with which she will be able to provide better customer service with her characteristic touch.

loans.use: to buy beauty products (makeup, hair straighteners, sprays, styling cream, etc.).

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta 5° grado, actualmente está separado de la madre de sus hijos los cuales viven con él, José vive con sus padres a quienes les ayuda económicamente.

José trabaja como motorista de agro ferretería desde hace varios  años y además los días domingos sale a vender jabones y detergentes a las ciudades cercanas.

Este crédito lo necesita para mejorar su vivienda ya que por el momento vive en la casa de sus padres.

Su sueño es darle educación a sus hijos y vivir en un lugar adecuado.
texts.en:
José, 41 years old, went to school up to the 5th grade. Currently he is separated from the mother of his children, who live with him. José lives with his parents whom he helps economically.

José has worked as an engine builder for agricultural hardware for a number of years and, in addition, on Sundays he goes out to sell soap and detergent in the nearby cities. 

This loan will be used to improve his house since at the moment he lives in his parents' house.

His dream is to provide an education to his children and to live in a suitable place.

loans.use: to improve his house since at the moment he lives in his parents' house.

loans.name: Hans

texts.es: Hans de 23 años de edad,  se dedica al comercio desde el año 2008, cuando aprendiendo de su padre, quien generó la tradición comercial de la familia, se empleó en la actividad de comercio y distribución de productos, para después con esa gran experiencia encausarse por el comercio de electrodomésticos a crédito, abordando todo el  mercado del suroccidente de la ciudad, como hasta la presente lo hace. Entre la oferta de Hans se encuentran neveras, planchas, colchones, muebles etc. Hans quiere ampliar su negocio incrementando la clientela y este es uno de sus  grandes   propósitos actualmente, porque más adelante sueña con tener su propia vivienda, aumentando así su bienestar y el de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 7 años. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará electrodomésticos menores, artículos del hogar, impactando la decisión de compra de sus clientes y potencializando el aumento de sus ingresos, lo cual se constituye en el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Hans is 23 years old. He has worked in commerce since 2008, learning the business from his father who started their family commercial tradition. Hans worked in the sale and distribution of products, and then later, thanks to this great experience, specialized in the sale of electric appliances on credit, covering the whole market of the southwest of the city where he works up to now. Hans sells refrigerators, irons, mattresses, furniture, etc. Hans wants to expand his business by increasing his customers, and this is one of his current objectives. In the future, he dreams of having his own house and in this way increase his well being and that of his family, formed by his wife and two children who are 2 and 7 years old. Currently, he is requesting a credikiva, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy small electric appliances, home items, to impact on the purchasing decision of his clients and to optimize the increase of his income, which is the proof of success of his credikiva.

loans.use: to buy small electric appliances and home items.

loans.name: Solanlle

texts.es:
Solanlle es una mujer de 38 años de edad, se dedico inicialmente al negocio de las confecciones en el cual duro tres años como operaria, después de pasar este periodo de tiempo inicio manejando un taller con un amigo el cual le enseño el oficio y la guiaba en todo el proceso para adquirir su propio negocio. 

Vive con sola y es madre de dos hijos. Hace poco tiempo es una mujer independiente que gracias a los micro créditos tiene la posibilidad de ser su propia jefe y generar un empleo pues su pecera es reconocida por su buen servicio al cliente; solicita el crédito para la compra de una estantería para ubicar su mercancía, pues tiene un muy buen espacio el cual por la falta de capital no es aprovechado de la mejor manera, su principal sueño es tener un taller con muy buena producción, cómodo agradable en el cual pueda encontrar una gran variedad de bolsos, crecer día a día como empresaria generando empleo y calidad de vida a los seres queridos que la rodean.
texts.en:
Solanlle is a 38-year-old woman. She initially made a living as a worker in the tailoring industry for 3 years. After that period of time, she began managing a shop with a friend who taught her the profession, and guided her through the process of acquiring her own business.

She lives alone, and has two children. She has been an independent woman for a short time now, and thanks to the micro loans, it's possible for her to be her own boss and create jobs, and her office is known for its' good customer service. She is requesting a loan to buy shelving to better display her merchandise. Her spot has a good amount of space, but due to a lack of capital, she isn't taking advantage of it in the best way. 

Her primary dream is to have a comfortable and pleasant shop with good production which offers a large variety of handbags. She also wants to grow day-to-day as a businesswoman and create jobs and a good quality of life for the loved ones that surround her.

loans.use: to invest in the construction of shelving and buy display cabinets to make the most of her business.

loans.name: Wael  Al-Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Wael Al-Hodeidah group has previously taken a Kiva loan. All the members of the group completely returned the first loan and now the group has applied for a second one of 170,000 YER from Kiva lenders. This group now consists of Niama, Elham, Baraka and Fatima. 

The sole member from the first group is Niama, who is the leader of it. Niama is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their first loan, which helped her to increase her business. She has finished all the installments of the first loan and asked a loan of 50,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase women's clothes, perfumes and incense to resell for her customers. 

Her husband became unable to look after the children, so Niama decided to help him in that responsibility through selling women's clothes, perfumes, and incense door to door in her area. Most of what she earns goes to cover the necessary needs of her family and she wants to increase her business. She is optimistic this loan will help her to make a good deal of money. The family's income is very limited and this loan will improve it. 

Niama will use some of her profits to furnish the house because it lacks of a lot of furniture and most of the furniture is very old. Niama hopes this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes, incense, perfumes, and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim is living in the Baku region with his lovely family: his wife, a 17-year-old son and a 10-year-old daughter. His son is going to 11th class, and in the future he wants to be a programmer. His daughter is going into fifth class of school. His wife is a housewife. 

Rasim has been in a poultry business for many years. He raises chickens and sells their eggs and meat. Today, to expand the poultry farm, he needs a loan in the amount of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this loan he wants buy more chickens. 

Rasim is very grateful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help. In the future he wants help to his children in education.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase various beautician materials and equipment to improve her business.

loans.name: Mark June Anthony

texts.en:
Mark June Anthony is a 22-year-old vocational graduate who lives in a rural village in Bago City. His father has been deceased for almost 20 years, while his mother, now living in Manila with her new family, is a housewife.  

Mark June Anthony has three siblings: two half sisters that are still in college and one half brother still in high school. Mark June is living with his auntie, and he has been working as part of a service crew for more than two years at a local restaurant. He is earning the minimum wage of PHP 285 (US $6) per day, but this income is only enough for his personal needs. 

Mark June would like to earn more for himself and for his family, and he believes that the training at Bagosphere might help him realize this goal.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-years-old single man from Jericho city. One year ago, Mohammad started his own business, which is a barber shop. He took training before opening this barber shop. 

Mohammad would like to improve his business to make it more attractive to the clients. He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his barber shop. This will improve his work quality and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Afrah Group

texts.en:
Afrah is the same group that received a previous Kiva loan. This new group consists of the same members without Khadiga. They had repayed all the installments of Kiva first loan and applied for a second one of 120,000 YER.

The leader of the group is Afrah who took out the first Kiva loan to buy more clothes and perfumes to resell. The previous Kiva loan helped her to enlarge her business and that improved the living conditions of her family. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their first loan. 

After she finished repaying the first loan, Afrah applied for a second one of 40,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase a sewing machine and the necessary sewing equipment to start sewing women's clothes inside her house to sell in her area. This loan will help her to enlarge her business more. The income of her family will increase and she can provide her father, who is unemployed, with the necessary needs. 

Her house lacks of a lot of home appliances and Afrah also plans to acquire some of the necessary appliances that the family uses daily. All members of the group thank Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan and hope this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and  the necessary sewing equipment to start sewing women's clothes inside her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for their store.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Adama  est l’homme qui est à la droite posant   sa main sur le boeuf. 
Adama  est un cultivateur âgé de 46 ans  marié, père de 07 enfants tous âgés de 14 à 02 ans dont 04 sont scolarisés et 03 non scolarise, et ma femme fait le maraichage et le ménage une chose qui m’aide à subvenir au bien être de la famille .Il n’est pas alphabétisé car il n’a pas eu une chance   d’aller à l’école.  
Adama  est un cultivateur dévoué dans son travail et  n’ayant pas  assez de  fonds pour exercer au mieux son activité d’embouche , suite à ce manque de fonds qu’il  a  fait recours à L’IMF pour avoir plus de fonds pour pourvoir acheter plus d’animaux pour l’ embouche . Adama a un rêve de préférence, que le  fond crédit accordé par l’IMF  soit continuel pour qu’il puisse avoir ses propres fonds dans l’avenir. Il s’approvisionne dans les foires de la localité et après approvisionnement il les revend dans les mêmes foires locales. Il est confronté souvent à quelques obstacles sur le marché tel que la chute    des prix. Adama réalise un bénéfice prévisionnel de 125000f par cycle de vie d’un prêt.
texts.en:
Adama is the man standing with his hand on the cow in the photo.  He is 46 years old, a farmer, married and father to seven children.  His children are aged between fourteen and two years old and four of them attend school.  Adama's wife grows vegetables and looks after their household, this helps Adama to provide for his family.  He never had the opportunity to attend school and so he is unable to read or write.  

Adama works hard as a farmer but does not have sufficient funds to improve his business.  This is why he works with the field partner.  He will use his loan to buy more animals for fattening up.  Adama dreams of continuing his business with funds borrowed from the field partner until he becomes self-sufficient.

He buys his animals at local fairs and resells them at the same fairs.  Adama is faced with many obstacles in his business such as falling prices.  Each loan cycle, he makes a profit of 125,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to buy a beef cow for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a 21-year-old vocational graduate who lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of five. 

Her father and mother manage their small eatery in the Bago public market. Roselyn is the eldest in their family and she has two siblings. Her younger brother is in high school and her younger sister is in elementary. Their total monthly family income of PHP 6,000 ($136) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This pushes Roselyn to find the means to help the family have more income. That's why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Roselyn dreams of helping her siblings finish their studies. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Roselyn have a better income in the coming months and improve her overall quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar and tea for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: Nelly tiene 41 años de edad es madre soltera con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y también presta servicios de mantenimiento. El préstamo lo invertirá en los estudios de su hija y en la mejora de su vivienda. Ella participa en el grupo “CAMINO AL ÉXITO”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Nelly is 41 years old, and she is a single mother with two dependent children. She makes a living selling food, and also provides maintenance services.

The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for the education of her daughter, and to improve her home. She participates in the group “CAMINO AL ÉXITO” [Road to Success]. The group thanks the KIVA lenders for the loan to be granted.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education and to improve her home.

loans.name: Rene Oswaldo

texts.es: Rene tiene 21 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 5 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia sus servicios son muy solicitados, actualmente trabaja en la construcción de un muelle en la playa, y es de esta manera que se gana la vida y busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida. Rene desea construir la pared de enfrente de su vivienda, que está hecha de lámina viejas y corroídas, por lo que él desea mejorar la seguridad de su vivienda construyendo la pared, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la pared de enfrente de su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que desea evitar que el próximo invierno dificulte la mejora.
texts.en:
Rene is 21 years old, and he is a hardworking man that lives in his own home along with his family. He has made a living as a carpenter for 5 years, and thanks to his experience, his services are in high demand. Currently, he is working on the construction of a dock at the beach, and this is how he makes a living and searches for ways to improve his quality of life.

Rene would like to build a wall at the front of his home, which is currently made of old and corroded sheet metal. He wants to improve the security of his home by building this wall. For this reason, he is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build this wall at the front of his home as soon as possible, since he would like to avoid the next winter which would make the project more difficult.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a wall at the front of his home.

loans.name: Pablo Noe

texts.es: Pablo tiene 40 años de edad es un hombre responsable que habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos, una niña de 11 años y un varón de 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para recoger la mayor cantidad de pescados y cangrejos los cuales vende en los restaurantes de playa para obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para sostener a su familia. Pablo desea construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda, ya que su servicio sanitario carece de una y el teme, por la contaminación que pueda estar causando a su familia y a sus vecinos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera evitar la contaminación en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Pablo, age 40, is a responsible man.  He lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children, an 11 year old girl and a 4 year old boy.  He is a man who puts forth great effort every day in order to get the most seafood and crabs.  He sells them to the beach restaurants in order to get the income needed to support his family.

Pablo wishes to build a septic tank at his house.  His bathroom does not have one, and he is afraid of the contamination that could affect his family and his neighbors.  

Therefore, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build a septic tank at his house as soon as possible.  This way he will avoid the contamination of his community.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build a septic tank at his house.

loans.name: Shenna Maureen

texts.en:
Shenna Maureen is a 21-year old high school graduate who lives in a rural village in Bago City. She belongs to a family of six. Her father died last May, 2014, and her mother is a housewife. 

Shenna Maureen has three siblings and is the youngest in their family. Her eldest brother is working in Manila for a department store, while her eldest sister, already married, is working in a casino. Another sibling is a call center agent. Their total monthly family income of PHP 12,000 ($271) is just enough to provide for their basic needs. 

This motivates Shenna Maureen to find means to help the family have more income. That's why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Shenna dreams of being able to support her family and herself, and this can be her big break.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Jhann Herman

texts.en:
Jhann Herman is a 21-year-old graduate of a vocational course and lives in a rural village in Bago City. He lives with his grandmother. He belongs to a family of five. His father is a security guard in Manila, and his mother is a factory worker, also in Manila. Jhann Herman is the eldest in the family and he has two siblings. His sister is already married, and she works as a cashier in one of the malls in Manila. His younger brother is still in high school. 

Their total monthly family income of PHP 13,0000 ($294) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Jhann Herman to find means to help the family have more income. That's why he braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Jhann Herman aims to finish his training and to help his family through his job.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta 3ª grado, está soltera y solo tiene un hijo que vive con ella.

Blanca se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde que tenía 12 años de edad, y tiene 55 años de cuidar aves de corral, además tiene muchos años trabajando en agricultura y su hijo es quien le ayuda con las diversas actividades.


Ella invertirá el crédito para comprar una vaca para criarla y además pagará una deuda que tiene pendiente.
 
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y cancelar todas sus deudas.
texts.en:
Blanca is 67 years old. She completed school through the 3rd grade, and she is single and has one son who lives with her.

Blanca has made a living doing domestic work since she was 12 years old. She has 55 years experience caring for poultry, and she also has many years of experience working in agriculture. Her son helps her in these various occupations.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of a cow to raise, and she will also pay a pending debt.

Her dream is to improve her home and pay off all of her debts.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise and pay a pending debt.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana de 34 años de edad, es la propietaria de una miscelánea  desde hace 3 años, la cual comenzó ofreciendo minutos a celulares, pasando por las recargas y finalmente vendiendo equipos celulares, accesorios, útiles escolares y mercancías diversas en general,  ajustadas a cada temporada, para poder responder comercialmente a la medida de su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  2 vitrinas y mercancía variada, con el fin de satisfacer la demanda  de su clientela e impactar sus ventas y con ello sus ingresos, que finalmente benefician a su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos, en las edades de 10, 11 y 12 años. Las ventas de Viviana en su miscelánea las realiza de contado trabajando de lunes a sábados, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y comprando en almacenes especializados del centro de Barranquilla, donde le ofrezcan precios con los cuales responder a las posibilidades de su clientela.   Viviana tiene como  meta ampliar su local y más adelante tener su propia vivienda, por eso se esmera en el servicio a su clientela y por tener un surtido organizado de manera elegante, para impulsar un mayor volumen de ventas.
texts.en:
Viviana is thirty-four years old and is the owner of a general goods store. She has been running this business for three years and began the business by offering minutes and then eventually recharges and accessories for cell phones, as well as school supplies and other general goods. She varies her merchandise based on the season so that she can respond to the needs and wants of her customers. 

She is currently requesting a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase two showcases and a variety of merchandise. This will help her to meet her customers' demands, thereby increasing her sales and her profits. This will allow her to ultimately benefit her family, which is comprised of her husband and three children, ages 10, 11 and 12. 

All her transactions at her business are made with cash, working Mondays to Saturdays from 8am until 8pm. She buys merchandise at specialized department stores in the Barranquilla city center, where she can purchase the goods her customers are requesting.

Her goal is to grow her business space and to later own her own property. She therefore commits herself to providing quality service to her customers; she organizes her products in an appealing way so as to encourage a greater volume of sales.

loans.use: to buy two showcases and a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Alejandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Alejandra de 28 años de edad, estudió bachillerato, está casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos.

Alejandra se dedica a los domésticos desde que tenía 12 años de edad y al cuidado de las aves de corral, actividad que aprendió de su madre, además se involucra en las actividades que realiza su esposo para llevar el sustento al hogar.



Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 2 cerdos y concentrado para la alimentación de los mismos.
 
Ella espera vender los cerdos en un futuro y obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 28 years old and has a high school education. She has helped to manage a household since she was 12 years old, and her mother also taught her to raise poultry when she was young. Today Alejandra is the wife of a farmer who grows staple grains, and the mother of their young son.  

Alejandra helps her husband plant, raise, and harvest their crops, but she's applying for a loan for the purchase of two pigs and concentrated feed for the animals. She hopes to sell the pigs when they're mature and boost her income.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs and concentrated feed for the animals.

loans.name: Nadera

texts.en:
Nadera is a 40-year-old married woman from the city of Jericho. She is the mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband has no job. Nadera works selling cosmetics and women's clothes in her home. She provides the family with a good income but it is still not enough to cover all of the family's needs.

Nadera took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more make-up and other beauty products to resell. This will improve her business and also her income.

Nadera appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more make-up and other beauty products to resell.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: “SOL NACIENTE” Es un grupo nuevo conformado  por seis mujeres dedicadas al comercio minorista. Sorbeis tiene 31 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella implemento su librería en casa de su mamá. El crédito lo invertirá  en la compra de más útiles escolares por campaña escolar cuadernos lapiceros lápiz cartucheras borradores. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Sorbeis es la tercera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
“SOL NACIENTE” is a newly-formed group made up of 6 women who make a living in retail businesses.

Sorbeis is 31 years old, and she is single with one dependent son. She started up a bookstore in the home of her mother. She will use this loan to buy more school supplies for the school year such as notebooks, pencils, pens, pencil cases, and erasers.

The group thanks KIVA lenders for the loan to be granted. Sorbeis is the third from the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, and pens.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 29-year-old single man from Beddya, a village near the city of Nablus. He works as an employee in the public sector with a very low income. Two years ago, he opened an internet cafe where he provides games and also general services for the university students.

Emad took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new computers for his internet cafe. This will help him to improve his business and make it more attractive.

Emad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new computers for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en:
Noura is a 21-year-old single lady from the city of Nablus. Her father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. Noura is a student at the university, where she studies nursing. She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions.

Noura took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Noura appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 22-year-old single lady from Gaza City. Her father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. Iman is a student at the university, where she studies accounting. She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions.

Iman took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Iman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 22-year-old single lady from Jabalia city. Her father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. 

Samia is a student in the university, where she studies elementary education. She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions.

Samia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Samia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Gisella

texts.es: Gisella de 26 años de edad, se dedica a la fabricación de trapeadores industriales desde hace 4 años, pues desde muy joven aprendió de  su madre y su hermana, quienes se dedicaron al oficio de la confección y que ella practicó siendo soltera. Hoy tiene su propio taller donde trabaja de lunes a sábados, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, comprando de contado en el centro de la ciudad y vendiendo también de contado  a comercializadoras que son su principal mercado. Su meta es organizar mejor su taller y más adelante hacer mejoramiento a su vivienda para aumentar su bienestar y el de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 5 años. En la actualidad Gisella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas como hilos, maderos etc, con el fin de incrementar su producción y ofrecer un mayor surtido a su clientela, para impactar su decisión de compra y hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Gisella is 26 years old and has for past four years manufactured industrial mops. She learned this skill from her mother and sister, who are dressmakers, when she was very young, and later went into business for herself. 

Gisella now has her own workshop, where she labors six days a week, from 8 in the morning until six in the evening. She buys supplies, paying cash at markets in the city center, and then sells her finished products to retailers, who are her main customers. 

Gisella's goal is to better organize her workshop and then make improvements to her home so that her family - her husband and their five-year-old daughter - will be more comfortable.

Gisella is applying for a Kiva loan, her first from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and will use the funds to purchase raw materials such as thread, wood, and other supplies. This investment will allow Gisella to boost production and provide a larger inventory to her customers. Her decision to apply for a loan will thus translate into commercial success.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as thread, wood, and other supplies.

loans.name: Waleed Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
These are the six members of Waleed Al-Hodeidah group. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood in Hodeidah city, Yemen. The whole group took out a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Mastora is the group's coordinator and is 32 years old. She is a mother of 5 children and lives with them in a small house. Selling ice-cream in the streets is Mastora's children's sole source of income. Unfortunately it is still a small enterprise and she wants to improve it. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary ingredients such as sugar, soft drinks and flavor to make ice-cream to sell and expand her business. This loan will help her to increase her profits and she can target a lot of customers. She plans to use a part of her profits to make a necessary expansion for her small house. Her only ambition is to provide her children with better living conditions. This loan will truly make a lot of improvements for Mastora's family.

Mastora hopes to increase both her clientele and her income.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soft drinks and flavor to make ice-cream to sell and expand her business.

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
Eustaquio es un hombre de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 3 años y una hija mujer de 5 años, y su negocio es la cerrajería.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, de buen carácter, responsable y trabajador. su negocio lo desarrolla en el ‘Chapare’ una zona rural que agrupa a campesinos productores de verduras, frutas, madera, cereales y otros, con grandes hoteles y empresas turísticas que ofrecen paquetes de deportes extremos, visitas guiadas o simplemente relajamiento con  comida y bebida. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Eustaquio es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que efectúa. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en la cría de gallinas y con sus hijos; la mayor está iniciando sus estudios en la escuela el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, para obtener agua deben caminar una distancia aproximada de 10 minutos hasta el rio para recoger agua en baldes y recipientes y depositarla en turriles para diferentes usos. Su actividad es la cerrajería; él fabrica puertas, ventanas, mesas, sillas, mostradores, etc., todo aquello que se pueda fabricar con metal de uso doméstico, actividad que realiza durante el día de lunes a sábado en su taller que se encuentra en su domicilio. “inicie mi negocio de cerrajería porque no había ningún otro en el lugar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es el único y no tiene competencia, la desventaja es el transporte de los materiales que debe traerlos desde la ciudad. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia los principales servicios básicos para que viva de buena manera, él desea realizar la instalación de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia tenga un hogar seguro donde vivir. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eustaquio solícita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia viva en un hogar seguro.
texts.en:
Eustaquio is a 25-year-old man who lives with his partner. He has a three-year-old son and a five-year-old daughter. He has a business as a metalworker. He is a good father, and he is entrepreneurial, upstanding, responsible, and hardworking. He operates his business in 'Chapare', a rural area with groups of peasants who farm vegetables, fruit, grains, and other things. In this area, there are also large hotels and tourist agencies that offer extreme sports packages, guided visits, or simply relaxation with food and drink. The weather in this area is tropical and warm with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Eustaquio is dark-skinned with brown eyes and short black hair. He is short in stature and has a thin physical build. His native language is Quechua which he speaks in his home, and he also speaks Spanish for general purposes and in his business. He shares his life with his partner, who works raising hens, and with his children. His older child is starting school, and the younger one is not old enough yet for school. They live in their own home made of bricks and cement with a roof made of corrugated iron. Their home has electricity, and they must walk 10 minutes to the river to get water in buckets and other containers, which they deposit in barrels for different uses. 

Eustaquio's occupation is in metalworking, He makes doors, windows, tables, chairs, counters, etc. He makes everything one can make of metal for domestic use. He works during the day from Monday to Saturday in his shop located at his home. "I began my business in metalworking because there wasn't anyone else doing this work in the area..." says Eustaquio. The advantage of his business is that it is the only one and he doesn't have any competition. The disadvantage is the transport of materials that he must bring from the city. His dream is to give his family the basic services so that they live well. He would like to install a potable water system in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room so that his family has a safe home to live in. This is his first loan with the institution in 6 years of working in his profession.

For these reasons, Eustaquio is requesting a loan to install a potable water system in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room so that his family lives in a safe home.

loans.use: to install a potable water system in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room so that his family lives in a safe home.

loans.name: Hercalita

texts.en:
Hercalita engages in rice farming. She grows and sells rice. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs. She is married, with three dependents, ages 16, 14 and 11 years old. She has been engaged in these kinds of businesses for ten years now. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, pig feed and vitamins. These items will help improve the yield of her farm and enable her to raise more pigs to sell, thus augmenting her income. She would also be able to prepare nutritious meals for the whole family.

Hercalita hopes that she can manage both her businesses properly to be able to finance the education of all her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta 3er grado, está casada y tiene 3 hijos que viven en casa, su esposo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y a cuidar ganado.


Miriam se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de la canasta básica, anteriormente trabajaba en un chalet en el centro escolar de la comunidad y así fue como adquirió experiencia.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar dos cerdas preñadas y concentrado para la alimentación de las mismas.

Ella sueña tener a futuro una pequeña granja de cerdos, además establecer un pequeño comedor en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Miriam is 61 years old. She finished school through the 3rd grade, and she is married and has 3 children that live at home. Her husband makes a living transporting passengers and caring for livestock.

Miriam makes a living in commerce, and she has a small general store. Previously, she used to work in a small snack shop at a school in the community, and that is where she gained experience.

She needs a loan to buy two pregnant pigs and feed concentrate to feed them. 

Her dream is to have a small pig farm in the future, and also start up a small restaurant in the community.

loans.use: to buy two pregnant pigs and feed concentrate to feed them.

loans.name: Idit

texts.en:
Idit puts on sporting events, races and citywide tournaments. Her father was known in the field and established several local and regional races. Six years ago, Idit’s father passed away. After finishing her studies, she decided the best way to honor him would be to continue his legacy, and she started this business, which she loves. Each year, she has two huge sporting events, including one in honor of her father. She also works as a freelance coordinator for races organized throughout Israel.

Idit needed this loan to pay for special imported equipment for marking a track in the hills and throughout the course, and to pay for trophies and other event materials.

Idit wants to continue and expand, and one day, wants her business to grow so that she has full-time work for herself and her employees. She wants to see the racing industry strengthen in Israel, both with fun community events and within the competitive sphere.

loans.use: to pay for special, imported equipment for marking a track in the hills and throughout the course, and to pay for trophies and other event materials.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like sugar, eggs, bread, biscuits, cooking oil, soap, shampoo, canned goods and soft drinks. She is 60 years old and a married woman with six children. Two of her children are still attending school. Together with her family, she lives in Talibon, Bohol.
Her husband also earns a small income, which helps to meet the family's daily needs.

Gilceria is asking for a loan to buy assorted items for the store. These items will improve the inventory of her store and improve her daily income. With this, she could balance her finances and able to settle her debts.

She could expand her sari-sari (variety) store to improve the family's living conditions and also continue finance the schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy assorted items for the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shelving, an entry door and frame, store signs and cards, as well as some of her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup and cosmetics for further expansion of her business

loans.name: Om Jad Group

texts.en:
Om Jad Group is comprised of four women. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. This community is hardworking, and they work as much as they can in order  to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of  80,000 YER from AMB.

Saleha's husband is a shoe mender in the streets. His income is very limited and not enough to cover the necessary expenses of his family. Saleha has started making a traditional food (Makhlota) in her house and selling it to the local residents in order to help her husband in covering their children's expenses. 

Her income is very small, and she wants to expand it. As a result, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary ingredients such as sugar, milk, flour and others materials to make Makhlota and sell it to expand her business. This loan will enable Saleha to make that food in large amounts, which will help her increase her income as well as her profits. This loan will reduce the working pressure on her husband, who works Sunday to Sunday to earn money for her children.

Saleha looks forward to opening a shop for making Makhlota and selling it to increase both her clientele and her income.

loans.use: to purchase some of the necessary ingredients such as sugar, milk, flour and others materials to make Makhlota.

loans.name: La Amistad De Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Elicia es socia del grupo nuevo “LA AMISTAD DE COCACHACRA”. Ella tiene 50 años de edad es soltera. Ella empezó su negocio de comida ambulatoria hace 23 años. Luego implemento un pequeño restaurant en su vivienda donde ofrece menú y platos extras además de galletas y  golosinas. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas insumos aceite arroz azúcar papas.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elicia se encuentra sentada viste polo blanco y jeans azul.
texts.en: Elicia is a member of the new group “LA AMISTAD DE COCACHACRA”. She is 50 years old and single. She started her business of mobile food 23 years ago. She managed to start a small restaurant in her house where she offers a menu and set plates besides cookies and sweets. The loan will be invested in buying more goods like oil, sugar, rive and potatoes. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan offered. Elicia is seated wearing a white shirt and blue jeans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like rice, potatoes,oil and sugar.

loans.name: Al-Helal Group

texts.en:
Al-Helal group received a previous Kiva loan. This group consists of four women who haven't yet completely repaid the first loan, but applied for a concurrent one of 210,000 YER from Kiva.

Salam is the new leader of the group. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to purchase traditional food ingredients such as sugar, milk, orange juice and other items to make Moasher, which is a traditional food, and sell it to expand her business. Despite the fact that Salam wasn't the leader of the first group, she warmly thanks Kiva lenders for their first loan, which helped her in increasing her business. 

With the new loan, Salam believes that soon she will be able to open a small shop to sell her delicious food. The living conditions of her family will improve. The profits from this loan will enable Salam to help her husband to make a necessary expansion of their house, which is very small and not big enough for all the members of the family. Also, some of the loan profits will be used to cover the school fees of her children next year.

Salam and the other members of the family thank Kiva lenders warmly for the previous loan and hope this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: to purchase traditional food ingredients such as sugar, milk, orange juice and other items to make traditional food (Moasher).

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José, de 24 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y soñadora, debido a la situación económica de sus padres, solo estudio hasta primer grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, solo tienen una hija y su suegra vive con ellos.

José, se dedica a la crianza de ganado, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años y fue su padre quien lo motivo a que iniciara este negocio, anteriormente únicamente se dedicaba a la agricultura.
 
José, solicita el crédito para comprar comida para ganado, de esta manera engordara su ganado y podrá comercializarlo a un mejor precio.
   
Su mayor sueño es aumentar la comercialización de ganado, porque de esta manera generará más ingresos económicos para su familia y así darles una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and is a hard-working and a dreamer. Given the economic situation of his parents he only studied up to grade 1. He is married and his wife works doing housework. They only have one daughter and his mother-in-law lives with them. José works raising cattle, a business he has been doing for 6 years. It was his father that motivated him to start this business. Before he only worked in growing crops.

José is requesting the loan to buy feed for his cattle and in this way fatten his cattle which he will be able to sell at a higher price. His main dream is to increase his sales of cattle as doing this he will generate more economic income for his family thus providing them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle and in this way fatten his cattle which he will be able to sell at a higher price.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is a 32-year-old married factory worker with two children and lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2011. Her husband is a 36-year-old construction worker. Her two children are in school. Together, they can make around USD $10 each day. 

Channy’s wooden house is old, and she would like to build a new, proper house, so she requested a loan to buy construction materials. With this loan, she will be able to have enough construction materials to build a proper house and live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a new, proper house

loans.name: Tám

texts.en:
Tám works in agriculture farming food, and he has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. He is 47 years old and is married with 1 child.

Tám lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is his first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tám faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Tám hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Cụm 20 Thôn Đôngthôn Đông Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Luận operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. Luận has been involved in this business for 7 years.

Luận is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 01 Cụm 20 Thôn ĐôngThôn Đông Quảng Nham solidarity group. 

In 2007, Luận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Luận has successfully repaid 8 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Luận hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 02-Thôn Hòa-Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Nhung is 30 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Nhung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Nhung has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. 

Nhung is the group leader of the Nhóm 02-Thôn Hòa-Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2008, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nhung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia earns a living by engaging in the buying and selling of sand and gravel. She is a married woman with seven grown children from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 10 years now.  To be able to continue to finance her livelihood, she decided to avail herself of a loan.

Aurelia has requested a loan to purchase additional stock of sand and gravel. These will help cater to the needs of her respective customers. In this way, her income will improve and she will be able to handle her finances.

With the additional capital, she would be able to expand her business to become more sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sand and gravel

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel de 39 años de edad, habita al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 11 a 15 años. Allí tiene una tienda, negocio mediante el cual vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos, cárnicos lácteos principalmente. Su mercado lo conforman amas de casa, que día a día preparan los alimentos que serán consumidos por su grupo familiar.  Cuando Maria Isabel decidió iniciar su negocio, lo hizo para apostarle al bienestar de sus hijos a su cargo, pues  en condición de mujer separada y debía producir para sostenerlos. En la actualidad su tienda funciona en un local de su propia vivienda y trabaja de lunes a domingos, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche sin cesar, con el fin de sostener ingresos suficientes, para cumplir sus sueños personales y familiares de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres en un mayor volumen, que le permitan tener un inventario ajustado a los requerimientos de su clientela e incrementar sus ventas, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 39 years old and lives in the south-west part of the city with her spouse and 5 children between the ages of 11 and 15. She has a store here, a business where she sells snack foods, groceries, soft drinks, meats and dairy products principally. Her market is made up of housewives that day by day prepare the meals that will be eaten by their families. When Maria Isabel decided to start her business, she did it to support the well-being of her children since as a separated woman she had to produce to sustain them.

Today her store functions in a part of her own house and she works from Monday to Sunday from 6 in the morning until 9 at night without stopping. She does with with the aim of maintaining sufficient revenues to achieve her personal and family dreams of prosperity.

Currently she is applying for a loan from KIva, her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy foods in greater volume which will allow her to have an inventory adjusted to the requirements of her clients and increase her sales, making this a successful KIva loan.

loans.use: to buy food in greater volume.

loans.name: Ma. Dina

texts.en:
Ma. Dina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Dina is 44 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Ma. Dina has a manufacturing (hollow blocks) business in the Philippines. Ma. Dina requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of cement, gravel and sand for her hollow blocks business.

In the future, Ma. Dina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of cement, gravel and sand for her hollow blocks business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 43 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresa is borrowing PHP 15,500 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresa has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nhóm 04-Thôn Bình-Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Bùi operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.  She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. Bùi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Bùi is 55 years old and she is married with 3 children.  She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Bùi is the group leader of the Nhóm 04-Thôn Bình-Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. This is Bùi first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Bùi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bùi hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 08-Thôn Hải-Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Thu has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar and milk. She is applying for a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

Thu has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Thu is 30 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a 6-member group, the Nhóm 08-Thôn Hải-Quảng Nham solidarity group.  In 2014, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn is 50 years old and married with one child who is in school. 

Juvilyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Juvilyn has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Juvilyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Juvilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
Basilio, de 58 años de edad, no estudio por falta de recursos económicos, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen tres hijos, pero solo uno vive con ellos.

Basilio, es agricultor, ha desempeñado esta actividad desde su niñez y fue su padre quien le enseño  este oficio.- Aparte de esto, se dedica a la producción y comercio de dulce de panela; cuando realiza esta actividad, tiene que salir específicamente a los cantones aledaños, donde se comercializa más el producto.

Basilio, solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio de dulce de panela y para comprar una cerca para pollos y concentrado para alimentarlos. 

Su sueño es hacer que su negocio sea rentable, comercializar el dulce al por mayor y exportarlo a otros países.
texts.en: Basilio is 58 years old and could not study for the lack of financial resources. He is married and his wife does housework. They have 3 children but only one of them lives with them. Basilio is a farmer. He has done this trade since he was a boy and it was his father that taught him. Besides this he works producing and selling panela (unrefined whole cane sugar). When he does this business he has to go out to the surrounding cantons to sell his product. Basilio is requesting this loan to invest in his panela business and to buy an enclosure for his chickens and concentrated feed for them. His dream is to make his business more profitable, sell his sugar wholesale and export it to other countries.

loans.use: to invest in his panela (unrefined whole cane sugar) business and buy an enclosure for chickens and concentrated feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 40 years old, married and has eight children. Four of her children are in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Myrna has been farming rice for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Myrna requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Ma. Armi

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Ma. Armi works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Armi is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle repair shop business.

Ma. Armi has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle repair shop.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 36 years old, married and has four children. One of her children is in school.

Mercy is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mercy has been farming rice for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 49 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amelita has a general store business in the Philippines. Amelita has been in this business for two years.

Amelita requested a 7,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items like snack food, detergents, dried fish and other groceries to sell.  In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like snack food, detergents, dried fish and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger number of bags from different lines.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 54 years old, married with one child is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Luzminda has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more spices to resell.

Luzminda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices to resell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 53 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Nilda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sarbelio

texts.es:
Sarbelio tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 4ª grado, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian en la escuela y el menor todavía no.

Sarbelio se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de la canasta básica, la actividad la emprendió por iniciativa propia, además trabaja en la agricultura en siembra de granos básicos en lo que ya tiene 23 años de experiencia, todas las actividades que realiza le han permitido salir adelante y sustentar a su familia.

Él solicita este crédito para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, sal, golosinas, bebidas, etc. para surtir su tienda.
 
Su sueño es que su tienda sea rentable y crecer poco a poco en las ventas.
texts.en: Sarbelio is 34 years old. He studied up to 4th grade. He has a domestic partner and 4 children, 3 of whom go to school; the youngest one does not go yet. Sarbelio works in commerce. He has a small store of basic consumer goods. He started this business on his own. Also, he works in agriculture. He grows basic grains and has already 23 years of experience doing it. All this work has allowed him to prosper and support his family. He is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, sweets, drinks, etc. in order to stock up his store. His dream is for his store to be profitable and to grow little by little in sales.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, salt, sweets, drinks, etc. to stock up his store.

loans.name: Santos Orbelina

texts.es:
Santos, de 38 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos solo estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos están en la escuela y el otro aún no asiste.

Santos, se dedica a la elaboración de pan para comercializarlo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace  muchos años atrás y fue su mamá quien la motivo para que iniciara este negocio.- Antes, únicamente se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos, su hija le ayuda en sus horas libres.
 
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar harina, levadura, azúcar y pagar mano de obra para elaborar el pan.

Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio, así como también invertir en una granja de pollos para poder comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Santos is 38 years old. Due to a lack of resources, she was only able to go to school up to the second grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has three children. Two of them are in school and the other one doesn't go yet.

Santos makes bread to sell. She has done this activity for several years, and it was her mother who motivated her to start this business. Before, she only took care of the home. Her daughter helps her in her free time. 
 
She is asking for the loan to buy flour, yeast, and sugar, as well as to pay for the labor to make the bread. 

Her biggest dream is to grow her business, as well as invest in a chicken farm to be able to sell them.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, and sugar, as well as to pay for labor to make the bread.

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
Ita is a 48 years old woman who is married with 8 children. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has 5 years of experience with this business. 

Ita has requested a loan to buy a new a sewing machine, scissors, material, an ironing board, thread, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family and her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, scissors, material, an ironing board, thread, etc

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the western part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is married and has two children. She lives in a village with her family. Her husband is a farmer and works to support his family. Adolat together with her husband support each other in difficulties and prosperity. 

Adolat has ten years' experience in sewing traditional robes for newly married and simple people. She sells her dresses (robes) in the domestic market where she lives. She has permanent clients and all are satisfied with her sewing. She earns good income from her business. She is planning to widen her business and asks KIVA lenders to support her. She needs to buy textile and sewing supplies for sewing traditional robes. Adolat awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy textile and sewing supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 52-year-old mother who was blessed with eight children. They are currently living in a rural community and she is managing a small retail store. She has operated this business for almost three years now. She aims to further improve this business and increase her income to help her husband in sustaining their necessities and finance the education of her youngest child, who is still studying. Due to capital insufficiency, Josephine is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of grocery items, rice, vegetables, meat and fish to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve more of her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items, rice, vegetables, meat and fish to resell.

loans.name: Jhonna

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jhonna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a cafeteria. Jhonna is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jhonna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 45 years old, living with her husband and two children in a rural village of Bovel district. Rice farming and sesame growing are the only main sources for her family’s income and she has been in this business for about 10 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 60,000 KHR but she is able to save 25,000 KHR each day. 

This is the second loan for Ny with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Taw Ka Yan Lay Village Group 1

texts.en:
This community is located in Taw Ka Yan Lay Village in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and consists of five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing 30 village customers.

This loan will help some group members to purchase crop farming inputs such as fertilizers and gas for farm machines. The other members will be helped in paying the labor allowances to the daily workers on the farm. 

Pictured above are CBO members from Taw Ka Yan Lay Group 1, named Aung, Aung M, Aung T, Myint and Hla. 

Included in the picture is Aung (in the middle), who is 53 years old and married with five children. He farms on his nine acres of crop farm planting seasonal foods. His wife also helps him on the farm as well as sorting out the household chores. Aung has been in this agricultural business for over 20 years. 

Like the other fellow members, Aung will use the loan to pay the labor allowance to daily workers and as well as to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase crop farming inputs such as labor allowances for daily workers and fertilizers

borrowers.first_name: Taw Ka Yan Lay Village Group 1

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old and married with twelve children, one of whom is in school. Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid five loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested a 7,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. Teresita hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Shofiq

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Shofiq. Shofiq lives in Kudus, east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, about 9 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Shofiq owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business in another sector, which is technology. Shofiq is a really hardworking guy and his community sees him as a trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Shofiq needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Shofiq’s goal in working with Ruma in the nearly future is to offer an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Shofiq is sitting in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments for members of his local community.

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
La, 34, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. She is a married mother of three dependent children. Her family’s income is from leasing rice paddy and cassava growing. She has been in this business for 14 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 43,000 per day.

La has just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her agricultural business. With this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business so as to earn more income for supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her agricultural business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to finish building the wall and to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is aged 61, married and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 28 years and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on purchasing their daily expenses. Due to insufficient capital in her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, coffee, and beverages to sell. She's hoping for more business improvement and expansion.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, coffee, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, eggplants, onions, cabbages, carrots, beans and more leafy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane. 

Analy has been sustaining her business activities with her past four loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She is borrowing 6,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Komlan
