texts.fr: Mr Komlan âgé de 32ans est célibataire et n'a pas d'enfants en charge. En 2010, il a démarré la vente des téléphones portables et ses accessoires au Grand Marché de Lomé. Étant un ancien client de WAGES, il est à son sixième crédit à WAGES et désire avec cet argent acheter des portables. Il souhaite réinvestir pour avoir une activité pérenne et subvenir aux besoins de ses proches.
texts.en: Mr Komlan, aged 32, is single and is not responsible for any children. In 2010 he started a business selling mobile phones and accessories in a big market in Lomé. Being an old client of WAGES, he is on his sixth loan with WAGES and wants to have this money to buy cellphones. He would like to reinvest so as to have a durable business and be able to cover the needs of his near and dear.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and accessories

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn is a 58-year-old married woman with two grownup children. She lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She runs a business selling boiled corn and she has been doing the business for over three years. Her husband is a 64-year-old carpenter who makes wooden beds to sell. One of her two children works as a construction worker and the other works as a factory worker. The family can make approximately USD 19 per day. Sokhorn would like to take out a loan because she needs finances to buy lumber to build a house and a small portion of the loan to buy farmland to cultivate rice. This loan will help her have a proper house to live in and also have farmland to cultivate rice. In the future, she is going save money to buy more lumber for her husband to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house and to buy farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla vit avec son sa famille(revendeuse et leur seul enfant à Lomé). Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il a démarré en 2011 la vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique ouvert pour cet effet. Il est à son troisième crédit. Comme perspectives d'avenir, il souhaite ouvrir une seconde boutique et fonder une famille financièrement stable. Il est âgé de 55ans.
texts.en: Komla lives with his family (his wife who is a salesperson and their only child) in Lomé. To support his family, he started up a general store selling groceries in 2011 in a shop opened for that purpose. He is on his third loan. As far as the future goes, he would like to have a second store and establish financial stability for his family. He is 55 years old.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items for resale

loans.name: Phai

texts.en:
Phai is 59 years old, living with her husband and seven children in a village of the Phnom Proek district. Rice farming and sesame growing are the only main source of income for her family. She has been in this business for about 3 years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 40,000 KHR.

This is the first loan for Phai with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old, married and has three children attending school. Due to financial hardship, Marilyn engages in cooking, selling meals and snacks within her community. She aims to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income to support the education of her children and satisfy their daily necessities.

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy pork, chicken, noodles, vegetables, pancit (noodles), seasonings and soft drinks to cook and sell.

Being a kind and industrious mother, Marilyn believes that someday she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken, vegetables, pancit (noodles), seasonings and soft drinks

loans.name: Vaoesea

texts.en: Vaoesea is a 55-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, yams, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Vaoesea has requested a loan to buy spades, weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, sharpening stones, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Vaoesea hopes to extend her plantation and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy spades, weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, sharpening stones, etc

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a generous woman. She lives in the western part of Tajikistan in a small town. She was born into a family of workers in 1966. She is married and has one child. Gulnora is a businesswoman and knows her activity very well. 

She has 15 years practice of trading dry fruits in a domestic market. She is one of the active clients in IMON and has a good credit history. It is profitable to do business in dry fruits, because the place where she lives has good conditions for planting. She also attracts foreigners to her goods because she offers the best quality of dry fruits, and customers are satisfied to buy her products. 

Gulnora requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy supplies to make dried fruits and to enlarge her business. She hopes her business will succeed and awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make dried fruits

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Coiffeuse et revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 2000, Adjowa demande un sixième crédit à WAGES pour l'achat des produits cosmétiques. Elle souhaite subvenir à l’amélioration de son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a 03 enfants et a un conjoint qui est revendeur. Adjowa quant à elle à 30ans
texts.en: Hairdresser and seller of cosmetic products since 2000, Adjowa is asking for her sixth loan from WAGES to buy cosmetics. She hopes to improve her business and support her family. She has three children and a husband who is a salesperson. Adjowa herself is 30 years old.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is aged 45, married, and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a duplicate keys and rubber stamp service in their town for almost 34 years. She earns a net income of PHP 1,500 daily.

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase keys and rubber to use in her business. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase keys and rubber to use in her business.

location.town: Beverly Hills Subdivision, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor works hard to support her family. Eleonor is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Eleonor has requested an 18,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more fish to make dried fish. In the future, Eleonor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for nine years.

In the future Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Corsenee

texts.en:
Corsenee is 57 years old and a widow with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Corsenee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Corsenee has been in this business for fourteen years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Corsenee would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Tit, 44, is a widowed father with two children residing in a rural village of the Prey Prosorb district of Kratie province. To support the family, he has been farming rice, raising pigs, and distilling alcohol for years. He can earn about 75,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day.

Tit has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now he is requesting another loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland. He hopes to produce more rice to increase his family’s income to make their lives better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, 34, is married with 4 children and resides in a rural village located in Kratie Province’s Kratie District, in Cambodia. For the last 16 years, she has been farming rice and fishing, both primary sources of the family’s income.

Sreymom is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is requesting a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor is aged 46 years and married with six children. She lives in a rural village of Kratie province’s Prey Prosob district, earning a living through growing cassava. To earn more income, her husband works as a paid laborer. Together, they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from their current businesses.

This is Sor’s group loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Srom

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kratie province’s Kratie district, Srom, 53, has five children in total. Srom and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice and growing cassava for 35 years to make a living.

Srom has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle.

Now she is asking for a loan to buy a solar panel for use in her family. She hopes to better her living condition.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for using in her family.

loans.name: Ayékinam

texts.fr: Divorcée, Ayékinam est une femme de 32 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à Vakpossito. Ayékinam vend du maïs et de l’arachide torréfié en parcourant tout le quartier et ses environs pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Ayékinam s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour commander des bols de maïs et d’arachide, Ayékinam demande ce crédit pour réaliser son objectif et tirer une rentabilité pour avoir son épargne.
texts.en: Divorced, Ayékinam is a woman of 32 who lives with her two children in Vakpossito. She sells maize and roasted peanuts, walking through the streets of her neighborhood, to satisfy the needs of her customers. She buys her wares three times a month at a market in Lomé. To order some bowls of maize and peanuts, Ayékinam is asking for this loan so that she can reach her goal, make money from her business, and put aside savings.

loans.use: to buy 22 bowls of maize and 10 bowls of peanuts

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is a hardworking woman. She was born in Panjakent at a village in 1982. Panjakent is situated in the western part of Tajikistan and is well known for famous good soil for planting. Shoira is proud to live in a beautiful place and with clear nature.

Shoira is married. She does a business of keeping livestock. She has four years practice of trading livestock. She buys livestock and keeps them about 10-15 days; then sells them in a domestic market. She tries to plant forage on her land at home to feed the livestock.

Recently her father-in-law has been sick and needs to be treated in hospital. She wants to help her father-in-law to be treated. Shoira is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to treat her father-in-law in hospital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to treat her father-in-law in hospital.

loans.name: Maria Nive

texts.en: Maria is a 39-year-old married woman with 7 children. She has a small plantation where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, pumpkins, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Maria has requested a loan to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, rakes, plant seeds, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Maria hopes to save her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, rakes, bush knives, seeds to plant, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy traditional medicine and incense

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is a bright woman. She is married and has four children. She has three years of experience in doing business. She is busy buying and selling livestock. Her business is near pasture land. She feeds her livestock with leftover food and plants foraged at home. She saves money and tries to work hard to have a good standard of living. She likes to do business in the agricultural sector and earns enough profit from her business.

Gulbahor is requesting a loan for the second time from IMON. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy cattle and expand her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 36 years old and is married with children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP)  through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, spices, and personal care products.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Maribel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, spices, and personal care products

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina works hard to support her family of 3 children.

She has a general store business and is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

Merlina has  sustained her business  through  4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 55-year-old married woman with three children (one child is still in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. Evelyn has been in this business for seven years. 

Evelyn requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more frozen foods to sell, such as hot dogs, sausages, tocino [sweetened cured pork], embutido [meat loaf], and other frozen products. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell, such as hot dogs, sausages, tocino, embutido, and other frozen products

loans.name: Ett

texts.en:
Ett, 44, lives with her husband and six children in a village of Kratie province’s Prey Prsorb district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing corn, sesame, and tobacco. Having been in this business for 26 years, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day.

Ett is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her tobacco growing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her tobacco growing.

loans.name: Kusmanto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Kusmanto.  Kusmanto lives in Kudus, east of Semarang, capital of Central Java, about 9 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  Kusmanto owns a stall where he sells mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits to his community.  Kusmanto is a young guy who is friendly and cheerful. His community sees him as a trusted and funny mobile provider.

As the business grows, Kusmanto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so community members can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. Kusmanto’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, using Ruma’s latest product, called Mapan.  As seen in the photo, Kusmanto is sitting in his stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones

loans.name: Leangheng

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kratie province’s Kratie district, Leangheng is 35 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living through rice farming and sugar cane growing. She has been in this business for twenty years. Together, they can earn about US $19 per day from the current business and can save about US $4 each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Leangheng with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a solar panel for using in her family. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for using in her family.

loans.name: Sauao

texts.en:
Sauao is a 33-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages ,pumpkins, tomatoes, and cucumbers to earn a living. She has done this for 2 years. 

Sauao has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives,and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since March 2015. Sauao hopes to save her profit to financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, rakes,and chemicals.

loans.name: Sarai

texts.en:
Sarai is a 48-year-old married woman with four children. She would like to start growing cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc., to earn a living. Sarai has requested a loan to buy bush knives, rakes, weed sprayer, and chemicals. 

Sarai has been a member of South Pacific Business Development since 2013. She will spend her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, chemicals, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tubers and vegetables

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a capable woman. She was born in the western part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is a widow and has two children. She has seven years of experience doing business. She is busy keeping livestock and selling them in the domestic market. She tries to feed and raise her children very well; it is not easy to raise two children alone. She lives in a village near pasture land, so doing business in livestock is convenient for her.

Mavjuda is sick now and needs to be treated at a hospital. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to be treated at a hospital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba has five years experience of doing business in agriculture. She was born in a family of agrarians in 1979. She lives in a small village with her family. She is single and does business alone.

Mahbuba, along with her parents, plants rice, cereals, potatoes, and corn on their land. She gains a good income from her business. Additionally, they have cattle, and she sells dairy products such as milk, yogurt, sour milk, etc. She sells only natural and fresh dairy products and has permanent, satisfied customers.

Mahbuba is planning to buy seeds for potatoes and fertilizers to make her land productive. She is asking for financial support from Kiva to buy seeds for potatoes and fertilizers. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy seeds for potato and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy soaps and ingredients to make non-alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a hardworking woman. She was born in south-western part of Tajikistan in 1976. She lives in small beautiful village surrounded by nature and productive land. 

Munira has worked in agriculture for 16 years. She is married and has four children. Her husband is physically handicapped and is an accountant. Munira’s children are growing fast; she and her husband work hard to feed the family. 

Her business trades livestock at the domestic market. She grew up in a farm family and was taught to work hard. 

Munira takes care of her husband and requests a loan from KIVA lenders to help support her husband.

loans.use: to support her husband

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehr is a citizen of the beautiful country of Tajikistan, where nature brings everyone together. She was born in the south-western part of Tajikistan in a small village in 1970. She is married and has six children. 

She is a challenged mother and careful grandmother. She has been in agriculture for ten years. She raises livestock  to sell in the domestic market. She likes agriculture and has been able to change her standard of living. 

She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to buy cattle and enlarge her business. She awaits your mercy and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman who works hard to support her family.  She has had a fishing business for 7 years.

She requested 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase a fishing net.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Merelie

texts.en:
Merelie is a 45-year-old married woman with  three children.  

Merelie has raised pigs for 3 years and  requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She haspreviously  borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merelie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Joemima

texts.en:
Joemima is a 53-year-old married woman with six children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Joemima has had a fishing business for 10 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy bamboo, a fish net and other materials.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, fish nets, and other materials.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 47-year-old married woman with five children, one attends  school.

Myrna has  raised pigs for 2 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 31 años de edad, estudió solo primer grado, por la situación económica de su familia en ese momento no pudo continuar porque tenía que trabajar, está soltero y vive  con su mamá por lo tanto es la única que depende de él.


Carlos tiene cuatro años de trabajar como corralero, además es albañil y cultiva la tierra, de su casa a la hacienda donde trabaja hay una distancia de 1 km ½ lo cual recorre en su bicicleta, y trabaja de 4 am a 12 md de lunes a domingo.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar un cerdo ya que tiene el tiempo y el espacio para cuidarlo y luego poder venderlo y así generar otro ingreso en su hogar.


En un futuro Carlos planea tener una granja grande de cerdos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 31 years old and only studied through the first grade. Due to his family's economic situation at that time, he could not continue in school because he had to work. Carlos is single and lives with his mother. As a result, she is his only dependent.

Carlos has worked four years as a cowboy, and he is also a bricklayer and farmer who cultivates his own land. From his home to the hacienda where he works is a distance of 1 ½ kilometers which he must cover on a bicycle. He works from 4:00 am until 12 noon, Mondays until Sundays.

Carlos needs the loan to buy a pig, now that he has the time and space to care for it.  Later, he can sell it and, thus, generate another income in his home.

In the future, Carlos plans to start a large pig farm.

loans.use: to purchase a pig, now that he has the time and space to care for it. Later, he will sell it, generating another source of household income.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Mary Ann is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods such as hot dogs and sausages.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods such as hot dogs and sausages

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 37 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Geraldine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers’ salaries for land preparation and other materials for farming.

Geraldine has been farming rice for ten years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation and other materials for farming.

loans.name: Felisidad

texts.en:
Felisidad is a 50-year-old married with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

She has had a fish vending business for 3 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Felisidad would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Zimfera

texts.en:
Zimfera is hardworking woman. She was born in the west-southern part of Tajikistan in a small village in 1976. She is married and has three children. Zimfera has six years of practice of doing business in a domestic market. She trades nutrition products and has permanent clients every day. She is a trustworthy client in IMON, and she had taken a loan three times and makes payment on time. 

She sells at a small store in a rural area and provides citizens of that area with everyday, needed products. Zimfera requests a loan to buy products for her store and enlarge the business. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie works hard to support her family. Vangie is married and has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines.

Vangie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Vangie has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and fishing.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old and has one child who is in school. She is in an agricultural business farming ornamental plants in the Philippines. Helen has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain it.

Helen requested a 17,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy seedlings, polythene bags, fertilizers and pesticides. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, polythene bags, fertilizers and pesticides for her ornamental plant growing business

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 27 years old and has three children. Carol is married, and two of her children are still in school.

Carol is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Carol requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Carol has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Myrla

texts.en:
Myrla is a married 56-year-old woman with six children, one attends school.

Myrla has raised pigs for 8 years and requests 12,000 PHP NWTF to purchase  piglets,  feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 5 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Beberly

texts.en:
Beberly is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beberly is 46 years old, and four of her children are presently in school.

Beberly has a fishing business in the Philippines. Beberly requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnet, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Beberly has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishnet, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Fajar

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Fajar. Fajar lives in Kudus, east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, about 9 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. 

Fajar owns a stall that provide game rental service and sells mobile airtime credits to his community.  Fajar is a young guy who is friendly and trustworthy. His community sees him as an informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Fajar needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Fajar’s goal toward Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.  

As seen in the photo, Fajar is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel, por la falta de recursos económicos solo estudio hasta primer grado, su esposa  únicamente se dedica a los oficios domésticos, por el momento no tiene ningún hijo.
 
Samuel, se dedica a la agricultura, pero solo por temporadas, cuando obtenido la cosecha de los granos básicos, la comercializa y otra parte la deja para consumo de él y su esposa; este oficio lo aprendió desde muy pequeño gracias a su padre, que al igual que él es agricultor.- Para llegar hasta donde tiene sus cultivos, tiene que recorrer 5 kilómetros todos los días y su jornada de trabajo es de 6 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde.

El necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como herbicidas, maíz y abono para el cultivo, de esta manera lograra una mayor producción y generara más ingresos.   

Su mayor sueño es, que esta cosecha que está apunto de cultivar, sea mucho más grande su producción, para ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Samuel, due to a lack of economic resources, only studied through first grade. His wife solely works performing household chores. At the moment, they do not have any children.

Samuel makes a living in agriculture but only seasonally. When he obtains his harvest of basic grains, he sells one part and saves the other part for him and his wife to consume. He learned this work at an early age from his father, who was also a farmer. In order to get to the place where he has his crops, he has to travel 5 kilometers every day. He works from 6 am until 3 pm. 
 
He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as herbicides and fertilizers as well as corn for cultivation. This way, he will achieve a greater yield and generate more earnings. His greatest dream is for the harvest that he is about to cultivate to produce a great yield so that he can help his parents economically.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as herbicides and fertilizers as well as corn for cultivation.

loans.name: Kosi Seyram

texts.ru: Kosi Seyram un jeune homme de 30ans revend des bouteilles de gaz pour subvenir à leurs besoins. Pour acheter plus de marchandises, il demande un quatrième crédit afin de subvenir aux besoins des clients. Il souhaite créer d'autres points de vente et fonder une famille stable avec le profit réalisé.
texts.en: Kosi Seyram is a young 30 year old man who resells bottles of gas to support his needs.  To buy more merchandise, he requests a fourth loan to meet the needs of his clients.  He hopes to create other selling locations and to create a stable family with the profits from this activity.

loans.use: to buy bottles of gas

loans.name: Susetya

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Susetya. Susetya lives in Kudus, east of Semarang, capital of Central Java, about nine hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only children (one daughter and one son).

Susetya owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and sells mobile airtime credits to his community. Susetya is a hardworking guy, and his community sees him as a friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Susetya needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are.

Susetya’s goal with Ruma for the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product, called Mapan.

As seen in the photo, Susetya is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Kankou  est la femme qui est à droite    tenant dans sa main le paquet de macaroni.
Kankou est Malienne , âgée de 49 ans et elle est mariée, mère de 05 enfants tous âgées de 06 à16 ans dont 04 sont scolarisés et 01 non scolarise, et c’est dans l’agriculture que son mari gagne la vie de sa famille. Elle a eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais son niveau d’instruction est très bas, elle a abandonné l’école  en classe de 3eme Année fondamental. Elle est commerçante de condiments, de riz,macaroni, de sucre ect…
Elle est courageuse n’ayant pas beaucoup de fonds pour exercer au mieux son activité de commerce de condiment ,donc c’est suite à ce manque de fonds qu’elle a fait recours à L’IMF pour prendre de l’argent afin d’acheter de produits.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les foires de la localité et après approvisionnement elle les vend dans les mêmes foires locaux, elle réalise un bénéfice prévisionnel  de 60000F Elle est confrontée souvent à quelques obstacles sur le marché telque la surproduction et la baisse des prix
Elle rêve toujours dans l’avenir que le fond crédit accordé par l’IMF soit continuel pour qu’elle puisse être indépendante dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Kankou is the woman who is at the right of the photo holding the package of pasta.  
Kankou is a 49 year old Malian who is married and the mother of 5 children ages 6 to 16 years old.  4 of them are in school and one is not.  Her husband supports the family through agriculture.  She had the opportunity to go to school but her level of education is very low, she left school in the third year of elementary school.  She sells condiments, rice, pasta, sugar and other items.  
She is courageous to go into business without very much savings, but it's because of this lack of funds that she went to the IMF to request a loan to buy products.  
She purchases her items at nearby markets and then resells them to gain an expected profit of 60,000CFA.  She is often confronted with obstacles at the market because of overproduction and the low price.  She always dreams of the future and hopes that the credit from IMF continues so that she can become independent in the future.

loans.use: to buy condiments, rice, pasta and sugar to resell

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her five children. Her husband has been working for a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shazia provides sewing services and earns income to help her husband manage the household. 

Shazia needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these supplies. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the needed supplies and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Ronilla

texts.en:
Ronilla is 57 years old and widowed with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from rice retailing and buying and selling charcoal.

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, milk, coffee, soft-drinks, spices, etc.

Ronilla has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, milk, coffee, soft-drinks, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 53 years old and married with eight children. With three children in school, Rosenda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosenda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Elima

texts.en:
Elima is 39 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling sandwiches, pies, and pork buns in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Elima has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, yeast, cooking oil, plastic bags, and other items. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elima will extend her business and support her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, yeast, cooking oil, plastic bags, and other items.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is a generous woman. She was born in a small village in Tajikistan in 1995. She is single and lives with her parents. After graduating from high school, she decided to enter a university and get a higher education. She studies management and is in the second year of her studies.

Tahmina is well known among her friends and fellow students. She is a goal-oriented, bright, confident, and capable person. She studies with excellence and wants to enter the profession of her major.

Her university has requested her to make a payment toward her studies, but her parents do not have enough money to pay the university tuition fee. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to pay the tuition fee for her studies. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her studies.

loans.name: Meretsil

texts.en:
Meretsil is 33 years old, and married with one kid who is in school.

Meretsil is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Meretsil has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Carmencita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening.  Carmencita is borrowing 30,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair for her fishing business.

Carmencita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 56 years old and married with six children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Sheila has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rhea Lyn

texts.en:
Rhea Lyn is a 19-year-old vocational graduate who lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She belongs to a family of six. Her father is a tricycle driver and is currently living in Manila, and her mother died five years ago. 

Rhea Lyn has three siblings. Her eldest sister is working in a mini-grocery store in the Pulupandan public market, while her eldest brother is still in college in Manila. Rhea Lyn is the second in their family, and she's been living with her aunt for six years now. Currently, she's working in a snack house in Pulupandan, and she earns Php100 ($2.30) daily, but this income is not even enough for her personal needs. 

Rhea Lyn would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at BagoSphere might make her realize this goal. Rhea Lyn's short term goal is to finish her studies. In the long term, she plans to have a stable job, have her own house & become financially stable.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a 2 month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is a 48-year-old college graduate and lives in Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She is married to Jason, who has been working as a company welder in Manila for eight years. They have two children, aged 11 and 10. 

Monaliza worked before as a private secretary in one of the companies in Hinigaran, and she currently has a mini-grocery store in her house. They live with a total monthly family income of only Php10,000 ($226). She wants to live out of subsistence. Thus, when she qualified for the 2-month call center training program of BagoSphere, she found hope that she can improve her family's life in a few months. 

Monaliza dreams to become a successful call center agent and have a stable job, and your tuition loan assistance might just make her reach that.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Reeta

texts.en:
Reeta is a 37-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband owns a printing shop. Her husband is the guardian of family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. Reeta has been running her own beauty salon for past year; she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business purposes. 

Therefore Reeta has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Reeta is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon

loans.name: Kathleen Ann

texts.en:
Kathleen Ann is a 22-year-old college undergraduate and lives in a rural village in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She belongs to a family of six. Her father is a utility worker in the municipality of Pulupandan, and her mother is a housewife. Kathleen Ann has three siblings -- she's the second in their family, and she has a twin sister. Her older sister is in college, and her younger brother is still in high school.

Their total monthly family income of PHP 10,000 ($226) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Kathleen Ann to find means to help the family have more income. That's why she braved the selection process of BagoSphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job.

Apart from helping her family, Kathleen Ann also dreams of having a stable job and finishing her studies in college. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Kathleen Ann have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 30-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 13 years; he is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs for his entire family. 

Kaneez's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for selling purposes. 

Therefore Kaneez has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also be helpful for him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Kaneez is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon is a 30-year-old married factory worker with four children living in the Kandal province in Cambodia. She has been working in a factory for over four years. Two of her children attend school. Her husband is 30 years old and he works as a construction worker. Thon and her husband can earn about USD10 per day. Now she would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy a motorcycle and have better traveling conditions. In the future, she hopes that her husband will become a construction foreman, to save money to renovate her house and support her children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.en: Matlyuba is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Matlyuba started to do her business two years ago. She buys and sells nutrition products for everyday life and has permanent clients. She is hospitable, bright and a goal-oriented person. She likes to do business and serve people. She wants to enlarge her business and buy products to sell. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy nutrition products for her store. She awaits your mercy and hopes to have a large assortment of products in her store.

loans.use: to buy nutrition products

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Aurelia dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.

For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which her husband is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Asma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This loan will help him to continue his business. Asma is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to repair his rickshaw

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 53-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past three years. Her husband is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Shaheen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g. rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
 
Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. Her husband has been running his own scrap business and one of her sons has been running a mobile shop for the past eight years. 

Rashida's son wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, her son is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Rashida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her son to purchase relevant items for his business purpose so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Rashida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's mobile business

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Rany is a 23-year-old single Lebanese man who runs his barber shop in a well-managed way. Rany is a hard working man who puts so much effort on developing his business and replying to his customers' needs.

Rany's first step towards developing and improving his business is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to do necessary decorating in his shop and increase his business merchandise with necessary facial and hair care needs.

At the beginning, Rany started his business with very small capital and he is working on increasing it.

loans.use: to do necessary decorating in his shop and increase his business merchandise with necessary facial and hair care needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university installment for this semester.

loans.name: Om Husam Al- Hok Group

texts.en:
Nawel is the responsible representative of the Om Husam Al- Hok group, which consists of four women members living in Hodeidah, Yemen who applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Nawel runs a humble business selling retail items in her area to guarantee a better future for her family. Her capital is very small and she works hard to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more goods of children's clothes and accessories to expand her business. Taking this loan will increase Nawel's income, which will help her to solve a lot of her financial problems which she has with her husband. She will be able to help her husband cover some of the necessary expenses of their family because his income is very small and not enough.

Nawel looks forward to opening a store to sell goods that will help her attract a lot of customers.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes and accessories to expand her business

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 44-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past five years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Rukhsana's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all above these products for resale purposes. Therefore Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
 
Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his general store business.

loans.name: Rolita

texts.en:
Rolita is 43 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable farm.

Rolita has been farming vegetables for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a 44-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop, and he is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all of his family members.

Shama has been running her own beauty salon for the past 17 years. She also contributes her income, along with her husband, to manage the household. She needs to buy different types of cosmetics and creams, a hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty salon; but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose.

Therefore, Shama has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn a maximally profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Shama is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a 27-year-old, married lady from a village near Jenin city. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.

Reham is a student in the university where she studies Mathematics. She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future to improve the family living conditions. Reham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Reham appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is a 20-year-old, single lady from Jabalia city. Her father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Hadeel is a student in the university where she studies Islamic Studies. She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions.

Hadeel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay university installments for this semester and this will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.
Hadeel appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Nelsa is 47 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Nelsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Nelsa has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Nelsa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 46 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business direct selling Personal Collection and Avon products in the Philippines, and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Janeth has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Janeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Shallimar

texts.en:
Shallimar is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a passenger tricycle business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen food and fruits.  Shallimar is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy wheels and other spare parts for her passenger tricycle business.

Shallimar has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her passenger tricycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 30 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan of Kes 40,000 that she is requesting she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is a 42 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. Hina has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years. She also contribute her income, together with her husband for managing the household.

Hina needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business purposes. Therefore Hina has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her in earning the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Hina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance

loans.use: to buy items to improve her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Rozinah

texts.en:
Rozinah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a brick-making business for the past six years, selling to people in the neighbor who are building houses. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access a loan and boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more materials to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to increase her brick-making business.

loans.name: Cyrillah

texts.en:
Cyrillah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Cyrillah has operated a brick making business for the past three years, selling to people in the neighborhood who are building houses. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more materials to increase her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to increase her brick making business.

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Lalyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets for her fishing business.

Lalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 37-year-old married mother of one child, who works as a hairdresser. She has thirteen years experience in this domain. Mirvat is a hard working woman, who puts much effort into developing her business and family's living.

Mirvat is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beauty products, and to start her special occasion dress rental business in the future.

Mirvat's development plans have no limitations, she works on gradually making them come true.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with special spring and summer beauty products, and to start her special occasion dress rental business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Zuleima

texts.es: Zulema de 36 años de edad elabora almuerzos para la venta;  sus clientes principales son los trabajadores de las construcciones vecinas, que demandan día a día su consumo en los medios días. Zulema trabaja de lunes a sábados, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde; su idea de negocio nació hace 4 años, cuando empezó a aplicar su experiencia de cocina a la oferta  de menús, entre vecinos y posteriormente se enfocó en los trabajadores de la construcción. A Zulema la contratan las constructoras y abastece a 80 trabajadores o más diariamente. Genera mediante su actividad  dos fuentes de ingreso más, que son los colaboradores que apoyan las operaciones de preparación de los diversos menús, que ella ofrece en el restaurante. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres en mayor volumen, con los cuales hace disminución en sus costos productivos, convirtiendo su credikiva en una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Zulema, 36 years old, prepares lunches to sell. Her main clients are the workers of nearby construction sites, who need food every day for their lunch. Zulema works from Monday to Saturday, from 5 in the morning until  2 in the afternoon. The idea for her business was born four years ago, when she began to apply her cooking experience by offering meals. At first she sold to her neighbors, and later she focused on construction workers. The construction contractors hired Zulema, and she provisions 80 or more workers every day. She has generated two other sources of income from her work, the collaborators that support the preparation of the different meals she offers in the restaurant. She is now applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy food wholesale. This allows her to reduce her production costs, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy food items wholesale

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kadzo operates a grocery, selling vegetables at a stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Mariam dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 52-year-old married mother of three children who sells clothes from her house. She has been doing this for fifteen years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Mona is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who has a good reputation in her area. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business and increase her merchandise with the new collection of clothes for the upcoming spring and summer season.

Mona hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with the new collection of clothes for the upcoming spring and summer season.

loans.name: Berinadeta

texts.en:
Berinadeta is a married woman with one kid, who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Berinadeta operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high costs of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Akhtari

texts.en:
Akhtari is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Akhtari's husband needs to make maintenance to his taxi. The current condition of his taxi is not good and it currently requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to properly maintain his taxi. Therefore Akhtari has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Akhtari's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. He will be able to provide better transport facilities and earn a profitable income. Akhtari also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Akhtari is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Erimina

texts.en:
Erimina is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Awalia

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Awalia. Awalia lives in Kudus, east of Semarang, capital of Central Java, about 9 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Awalia works in one small private company as an employee. She knew Ruma from a Ruma sales executive coming to her house, and she decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to start up a business. As a young lady, Awalia realized that she has to improve her life, that’s why she always wants to learn anything that is related to business.

As the business grows, Awalia needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Awalia’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.

As seen in the photo, Awalia is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 20-year-old single lady from a village near Ramallah city. |Her father works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. This is the only source of income for the family.

Amneh is a student at the university where she studies Computer Science. She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions. Amneh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay university installments for this semester. This will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Amneh appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda, is aged 50, married to a farmer and blessed with one child. She owns, and has managed, a retail store in her village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 daily. Her net income was usually spent on house improvements.

Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase chips, coffee, sugar, beverages, and food seasonings to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase chips, coffee, sugar, beverages, and food seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Santos Saturdino

texts.es:
Santos Saturdino tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en una zona rural del distrito de de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, y se encuentra ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El tiene una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda servicio de transporte público en el distrito de Pucará, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace tres años, también cuenta con sus cultivos de pan llevar. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de accesorios para su vehículo así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de este y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Saturdino is 41 years old. He lives with his son in a rural area of the Purcará district, whose people work in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has his own motorcycle taxi, which he uses to provide public transportation service in Pucará district, and has been doing this work for three years. He also has his staple crops. He has requested a loan to buy accessories for his vehicle, as well as to do repairs on it and maintain it, so that he can make more income for his family, which will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy accessories for his vehicle, and to repair and maintain it

loans.name: Lie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell fish business and pig fattening. Lie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Lie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en: Beatrace is a 47-year-old married lady with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a business of growing bananas and at the same time earns a monthly salary from the local government that gives her additional income. She is faced with hardships of competition that cause the growth of her business to lag behind. Besides that, she hopes to venture into a retail business so that she can boost her income. She has asked for a loan to help pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Kiko

texts.en:
Kiko is married with four school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a Khanga selling business (women's wrap dresses). She sells from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas (women's wrap dresses) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products such as coffee, sugar, beans, bouillon, soft drinks, soups, etc. to stock her store

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 42-year-old woman, and the mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, selling fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Zubaida's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits to resell, so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position her husband is not in a good condition to purchase fruits for his business.

Therefore Zubaida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase the above items for his business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: grow her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Danya

texts.en:
Danya is a 21-year-old married lady from a village near Ramallah city. Her husband works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Danya is a student in the university where she studies Finance. She wants to complete her study and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions. 

She took a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. It will also help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Danya appears above in the photo.

loans.use: to pay university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
