As a married parent of nine children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and buy-and-sell charcoal. 

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Anita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her general store business, like soft drinks, rice, sugar, chips, eggs, etc. 

 She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soft drinks, rice, sugar, chips, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 40 years old and married with four children, one of whom in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Anabel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Anabel has been farming sugarcane for 17 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Scolastica has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan Scolastica is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She operates a vegetable and fruit selling business, selling to the neighbors and passersby in the neighborhood

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase green vegetables and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Elizabeth operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. The high cost of transportation to her place of operation is a challenge she faces.

With the 50,000 KES, Elizabeth wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. 

She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a beauty shop business for the past two years, while also selling handbags, jewelry, dresses and shoes to the neighbors and the school teachers around her place of operation. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of handbags, dresses and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of handbags, dresses and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has five school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Fatuma operates a business of renting houses to people in a nearby town. In addition, she also operates a phone charging business which brings her another source of income. She faces a challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase cement and sand for construction of another rental house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction.

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en:
Clarice, a married mother of two school-going children, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, Clarice has operated a dairy farming business, selling as retail and at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With this Kshs 30,000 loan, Clarice will purchase livestock medicine and cow feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and dreams of adding more dairy cows and starting a motorcycle business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock medicine and cow feeds

loans.name: Gulafzo

texts.en:
Gulafzo, a hardworking woman, was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1950. A widowed mother of three and careful grandmother, she lives in a village with her son. 

For about 16 years, Gulafzo has been buying and selling pillows, bed linens, towels, tablecloths, etc., conducting her business in the centre of the city, where she has a regular base of clients. Her son supports and helps her in the business, and he also sells men’s wear at the market. 

Gulafzo has requested a loan from KIVA lenders to buy more pillows, bed linens, towels, tablecloths, etc. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy pillows, bed linens, towels, tablecloths, etc

loans.name: Renad

texts.en: Renad is a 21-year-old single lady from a village near Tulkarem city. Her father works as an employee in a local company  where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Renad is a student at the university where she studies law. she wants to complete her study and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions. Renad took a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. Thiis will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Renad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 50-year-old hardworking lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a business growing bananas, and at the same time, she rears animals that add to her income. 

Grace is facing hardships with weather changes that affect her business returns. Besides that, she has future prospects of adding another project of poultry farming. Grace has asked for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and married with twelve children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teresita has been farming vegetables for seven years and earns additional income from food vending.

Teresita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable garden.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Kiva lenders, the picture shows Irene, who started farming 14 years ago on a small inherited piece of land in Mugwe, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of five children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, which makes her very proud. She is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device used to cut hay into small pieces before mixing it with other forage for better feeding of the cow. The chaff cutter also prevents animals from rejecting any part of their food. Irene believes that with this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. 

Irene waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Hamza dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES loan that she is requesting, Hamza wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, beans and soap to sell in her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, beans and soap to sale in her shop.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Saumu has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay her for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan Saumu is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married mother with five children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her first loan was very beneficial for her since she was able to purchase goats to slaughter and start her business. Before, she did not have enough capital to work with and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments in time.

Elizabeth always struggles to improve her butcher shop, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Elizabeth is requesting a loan to purchase more goats to slaughter and sell.She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Bintamisi

texts.en:
Bintamisi is a widow with six children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Bintamisi operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat for her food cooking business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with five children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house with her husband who is an area chief.
She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar and she intends to continue with the business because it helps her to support her family.

With the loan, she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, soaps, maize flour and wheat flour for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice,soaps, maize flour and wheat flour for sale in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has been blessed with seven children who are now attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a dairy farming business, selling at retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. 

In her place of operation, she faces the major challenges of seasonality and transportation. She dreams of adding more dairy cows.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase medicine and cow feeds for her livestock. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and cow feeds for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more hairdresser equipment to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.pt:
O senhor Virgílio E militar tem 31 anos de idade, é casado, pai de 2 filhos  e vive na casa própria.Dos filhos um frequenta o ensino primário e o outro ainda é menor.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar um televisor plasma grande e um fogão.
Seus sonhos e esperança para o futuro são ter uma casa melhorada, ter uma barraca e adiquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal.
Diz que tem como desafio a insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassa-los faz poupança e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Mr Virgílio is in the military and is 31 years old, married, has 2 children and lives in a house he owns. One of his children goes to primary school and the other is still too young to go to school.

He says that with this loan he will buy a plasma TV and a stove.

His dreams and hopes for the future are to have a better house, a stall from which he can sell things and to purchase a vehicle for private use.

He says that his challenge is the lack of funds and to overcome this he will save money and solicit further loans to carry out his plans.

loans.use: buy a plasma TV and a stove.

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed is a 22-year-old single man from a village near Tulkarm city. His father works as an employee in a local company with a very low income. Saed is a student in the university where he studies Engineering. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions. 

Saed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has. Saed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
O senhor Manuel de 45 anos de idade, é solteiro, comerciante, pai de 1 filho, este ainda menor de idade e e responsável por 2 sobrinhas, vive em casa própria. 

Com  o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar cervejas, refrescos, sumo, agua, bolachas, doces, ovos, pão, para reforçar o seu negocio. 
   
O cliente tem como sonho,fazer acabamentos em sua casa,  ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes e  construir uma outra barraca ao lado para confecionar alimentos para aumentar a renda familiar.

O cliente tem como principais desafios os financeiros , tem recorrido ao xitique e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para poder alcançar os seus objetivos bem como suprir as suas dificuldades. Vivendo actualmente sozinho, isto e sem a esposa tem dificultado sua actividade porque precisa as vezes de sair para fazer compras perde a receita do dia porque tem de fechar  a barraca.
texts.en:
Mr Manuel is 45 years old, single, a trader and the father of 1 son. His son is still a minor and he is also responsible for 2 nieces; he lives in a house he owns.

With this loan he plans to buy beers, sodas, juice, water, cookies, sweets, eggs and bread to reinforce his business.

He dreams of finishing off his home, expanding his business to respond to the needs of his clients and of building another stall next to the one he has to make food so as to increase the family's income.

His main challenges are financial ones and he has made use of a savings group and intends to take out further loans to carry out his objectives and dampen his difficulties. As he currently lives alone - that is, without a wife - he has faced bigger challenges because sometimes he needs to leave to buy things and he loses out on the income for that day as he has to close his stall.

loans.use: buy beers, sodas, juice, water, cookies, sweets, eggs and bread to reinforce his business

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A senhora Maria de 45 anos de idade é mãe de 8 filhos, 3 dos quais ja independentes, 3 frequentando o ensino secundário e 2 frequentam o ensino primário. 
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar cimento, areia, pedra e ferro para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como sonho, concluir a sua casa e comprar bens e um carro para o uso pessoal, sonha também em ampliar o seu negócio.
Os principais desafios são financeiros e tem recorrido ao trabalho e ao xitique para suprir as suas necessidades. Pretende tomar mais crédito para ajudar a suprir as suas dificuldades.
texts.en:
Ms Maria is 45 years old and is the mother of 8 children, 3 of whom are independent, 3 who go to high school and 2 who go to primary school.

With this loan she plans to buy cement, sand, stone and iron to continue the building work on her house.

Her dream is to finish her home and buy goods and a car for personal use. She also dreams of expanding her business.
Her challenges are financial ones and she has turned to work and savings groups to overcome her difficulties. She plans to request further loans to help her with her needs.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, stone and iron to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

Juliet has been in this business for eight years. Juliet earns more income from buying and selling used clothing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Janily

texts.en:
Janily is 36 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Janily works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Janily has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Sadress

texts.en:
Sadress, a 37-year-old married mother of three children (two go to school) is living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells wines and spirits and earns additional income from a salary at a bar business where she has been for the last eight years. She is a hardworking woman looking forward to educating her children and expand her business. She faces the difficulty of high competition.

Sadress is requesting a loan to buy more wines and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy more wines and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a 39-year-old male, married with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Bosco has sold crude salt from a salt lake, Katwe, for the past eight years. He supplements his income with the proceeds from rentals.

He has a dream of buying a vehicle to transport his salt across borders despite the unpredictable weather changes being a challenge, especially during the rainy season where salt production is low. Bosco is requesting for a loan to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old and married with four children, all of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. She started the business of selling beers, sodas and juice so as to raise the income of her family. 

Grace hopes to expand her business and educate her children although she is disturbed by the hardship of high license fees. She will use the loan to buy more beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mary operates a grocery vegetable selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence, who lives in Hoima, Uganda, is a 55-year-old married father of eight children, four of whom attend school. Lawrence sells clothes and supplements his incomes by farming. His biggest challenge is inadequate capital to buy more stock.

Lawrence has requested this loan to buy more clothes to sell. He hopes to grow his business and pay school fees for his children in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwakweja

texts.en:
Mwakweja is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a meat goat selling business. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operations.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Mueni

texts.en:
Mueni is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her school going kids.

Mueni has operated a food selling business, making dumplings, flat bread for sale and other foods for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and lack of enough capital for the business. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to buy various vegetables, cooking oil, rice and maize flour to cook and sell in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy various vegetables, cooking oil, rice and maize flour to cook and sell in her business.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a hard-working married man, charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children and two attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He drives a car for transport as his main source of income, supplemented by income from owning rentals. He desires to grow and pay school fees for his children. He will use the loan facility to buy a new car for transport however much bad roads pose a threat to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new car for transport business.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman and has no children. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Kadzo sells fruit and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Kadzo is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fruit and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Umazi has owned a food stall business where neighbors and town dwellers are. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of customers, so she experiences losses of her perishable goods.

With the 50,000 KES loan, Umazi wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Bebita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Bebita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Bebita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. Alice dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 51 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, noodles, rice, etc. to sell.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, noodles, rice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 49 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. 

Joyce is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fermented shrimp.

Joyce is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that  has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mwabilo

texts.en:
Mwabilo is a married woman and has been blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Mwabilo has operated a fish-selling business for over seven years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She started in 2000 her home-based beauty and hairdressing business to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs and to develop her acquired talents.

Rabab is a hardworking woman, well known in her region for her special talents and customer care she provides her customers.

Rabab is working on developing her business, but the lack of cash is limiting her development plans. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary furniture for her house and her home-based business needs. This is a first step forward towards developing her business.

loans.use: to buy necessary furniture for her house and her home-based business needs.

loans.name: Stars 88180 Group

texts.en:
Shafika is the featured borrower for Stars 88180 Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Shafika is a 48-year-old, married mother of five children, who has been selling bicycles for 15 years, to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop her business and increase her merchandise with a new collection of bicycles to satisfy her customers in the upcoming spring and summer season. 

Shafika is the lady sitting in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Eman is a 42-year-old, married mother of two children, who has an electronics shop and wants to develop her business, while Samah is a 25-year-old, married lady who is pregnant now and wants to start a new business. Eman is the first lady on the right, and Samah is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of bicycles to satisfy her customers in the upcoming spring and summer season.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She has had a rental business for 10 years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Irene will be using the loan to buy cement, ballast and other materials for constructing more rental houses. She hopes that this will help her to educate her children, and that she will pay back her loan. This is her fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid the previous loans successfully. 

Irene's hopes and dreams for the future are to live a comfortable life and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase cement, ballast and other materials to construct more rental houses, and use the profits to educate her children.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 35-year-old married woman, living with her husband and one child. She financially cooperates with her husband to pay their heavy life expenses. 

Abir has owned a fruit and vegetable shop since 2012. She has a good reputation in her town and she welcomes customers from different areas. Today, Abir is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to increase her store’s inventory and to renovate her shop in order to improve her job. She states that the loan will certainly help her expand her business and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a married woman with three children; all attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Katana operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Kuvyoda

texts.en:
Kuvyoda is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, Kuvyoda has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 25,000 KES loan that she is requesting, Kuvyoda wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trucking service business in the Philippines. He is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of his trucking service for his business.

Roberto has been in this business for eight years. He also earns more income from farming sugarcane and buying and selling rice. Roberto has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save money to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of his trucking service.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en: Fidele is 31 years old. He is married with one child, aged one year and not yet going to school. He sells drinks from sorghum and he has been in a business for the past five years, while his wife is a businesswoman.  With the loan, he would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In the future, he aims to earn at least 700,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 38 years old. She is married with four children aged between one and 18 years; three of them go to school. She owns a shop and she has been in business for three years, while her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 600,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a married woman and has been blessed with four kids, who all attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mwenda operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over seven years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mwenda dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. In addition, she also has a posho mill business in the neighborhood. She faces major challenges of transportation and competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase perfumes, incense,and ready made women's clothes in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various merchandise, clothing, shoes, domestic articles in general

loans.name: Santos Cirilo

texts.es:
Santos tiene 63 años de edad, por razones personales tuvo que separarse de su esposa, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y pueden valerse por si mismo.


Santos se dedica a la agricultura y además es albañil, lo aprendió de su tío y es muy reconocido en su comunidad por lo bien que trabaja.
 
Él necesita el crédito para comprar los materiales que le hacen falta para terminar de construir su nueva casa.  

Sus planes son trabajar muy duro para amueblar su nueva casa.
texts.en:
Santos, age 63, had to separate from his wife for personal reasons.  His children are adults and able to look after themselves.

Santos is a farmer and a bricklayer.  He learned from his uncle, and he is very well-known in his community for the good work he does.

He needs the loan to buy the materials he needs to finish building his new house.

His plan is to work very hard in order to furnish his new house.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to finish building his new house.

loans.name: Munyazi

texts.en:
Munyazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De La Zona A Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Las Estrellitas de la Zona A”. Está conformada por 5 mujeres trabajadoras. Este es el caso de Ina de 39 años de edad  casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de comidas. Hace más de 2 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su casa. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz verduras y aceite. El grupo “Las Estrellitas de la Zona A” agradecen a los inversionistas de Kiva que hicieron posible éste crédito y se comprometen a trabajar honradamente. Ina se encuentra de pie es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo color plomo.
texts.en:
This is the new group “Las Estrellitas de la Zona A.”  It is made up of 5 hard-working women.

Ina is 39 years old, married,  and has 3 dependent children.  She works at the business of selling food.  She has been carrying out this business for two years.  Her greatest desire is to finish building her house.  She is asking for the loan to buy rice, vegetables and oil.

The group “Las Estrellitas de la Zona A” are grateful to the Kiva investors that made this loan possible and they promise to work honestly and honourably.  Ina is standing, the first person on the right side, wearing a gray shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables and oil

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad habitada por gente amable que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se ubica en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, tiene 08 años de experiencia en este negocio y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la cosecha, con esto Eloy espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eloy is 34 years old and lives with his spouse and 4 children in the district of Cañaris, a community inhabited by friendly people who work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in the province of Ferreñafe, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

He works growing coffee. He has 8 years of experience in the field and has good references from his neighbors. He will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops as well as contract labor for the harvest. Doing this Eloy hopes to offer a higher quality coffee to his clients. This will increase his level of income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to use manure and fertilizer for the maintenance of his coffee crops as well as contracting labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two pigs to raise and then sell them.

loans.name: Vitelio

texts.es:
Vitelio, de 21 años de edad, proviene de una familia muy humilde y de escasos recursos económicos, solo estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltero y únicamente vive con su mamá y dos hermanos.

Vitelio, se dedica a vender pan, esta actividad la realiza desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, antes trabajaba como ayudante de un albañil; trabaja todos los días y hace un recorrido de 20 kilómetros,  para llegar a muchos cantones, que es donde el vende este producto y lo hace en su motocicleta.

Vitelio, solicita el crédito para comprar una motocicleta, ya que la que tiene no le funciona bien y tiene miedo de que le suceda un accidente.     

Su mayor sueño, es apoyar a su mamá para que tenga su propia casa.- Además, quiere que su negocio crezca para vender más pan y ayudar a sus hermanos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Vitelio, age 21, comes from a very poor family with limited economic resources, and he went to school only until the sixth grade. He is single and he lives only with his mother and two brothers. 

Vitelio sells bread, an occupation that he has been engaged in for five years; before this, he worked as a bricklayer’s assistant.  He works every day, travelling 20 kilometers on his motorcycle to many cantons where he sells this product.

Vitelio is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle, as the one he has doesn’t work well, and he’s afraid an accident might happen.

His biggest dream is to support his mother so that she may have a house of her own, and he wants his business to grow in order to sell more bread and help his brothers so that they may go to school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle, as the one he has doesn't work well, and he's afraid an accident might happen.

loans.name: María Gumercinda

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien es profesor del instituto de su pueblo, dos de sus hijos viven en Estados Unidos, ya que tuvieron que emigrar para buscar una mejor vida, los otros dos muchachos actualmente estudian.

Ella se dedica a cultivar la tierra con sus hijos, es una mujer luchadora y con la frente muy en alto pues siempre se ha dedicado a cultivar para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos.

María necesita el crédito para comprar abonos, insecticidas, pesticidas y demás elementos para el cultivo de maíz.
Ella desea trabajar muy duro para que sus dos hijos terminen sus estudios de bachillerato y que puedan continuar con sus estudios superiores para que sean personas de éxito en toda su vida.
texts.en: María is 51 years old. She lives with her husband who is a teacher at the institute of their town. Two of their children live in the United States, because they had to emigrate to look for a better life. The other two boys are currently studying. Maria works cultivating the land with her children. She is a hardworking and resolute woman, because she has always worked in farming to help her husband support their children. Maria needs a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides, and other elements to cultivate corn. She wants to work very hard so that her two children finish high school and are able to continue with college in order to be successful people in their lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides and other elements to cultivate corn.

loans.name: Odile

texts.en: Odile is 34 years old. She is married with four children aged between 4 and 15 years old, and two of them go to school. She owns a shop and she has been in a business for 15 years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, she aims to earn at least 600,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda earns a living by operating a funeral parlor, a business that provides burial and funeral services. She is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. Three of them are still attending school. She lives in Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy caskets and other materials to use in a funeral business. This will help improve the operation of her business and could cater to her respective customers' needs and preferences. In this way, her income will be augmented. She could handle her business and able to expand it, thus providing her children with proper diets.

She believes that with proper management of her existing business, it would help uplift the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy caskets and other materials to use in a funeral business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 63 years old and married with two children. With children in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, breads, coffee, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for 17 years. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, breads, coffee, etc

loans.name: Nzalambi

texts.en:
Nzalambi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling goat meat to the neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation and transportation in her place of operations. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Dama operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Dama dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Mulongo

texts.en:
Mulongo is married and has four school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mulongo has operated a retail business of selling paraffin for use in cooking to neighbours. She faces a challenge of delayed payments, hence low profits in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to establish rental houses, and purchase cement and sand for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like biscuits, sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying long enough to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of biscuits, sugar cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of biscuits, sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Mueni

texts.en:
Mueni is married and has four school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mueni has operated a business of selling vegetables and fruits. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to establish rental houses, and purchase cement and sand for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Luvuno dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman and staying together with her husband and four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to be a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Maria Rosalina

texts.es:
María, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, se dedica a atender una tienda de productos varios y su esposo es empleado como abogado en un juzgado, su negocio lo tiene hace más de 7 años y está ubicado en su vivienda, sus clientes son sus vecinos y no tiene un horario establecido de trabajo.
Comprará bebidas, huevos, granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, pan, veladoras, etc., al mayoreo a sus proveedores para ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes y generar más ingresos para apoyar con los gastos de su familia y cancelar su deuda.
María tiene proyectado continuar trabajando para tener los recursos económicos necesarios culminar sus estudios y de esa manera tener un mejor futuro junto a su familia.
texts.en: María is 36 years old. She is married and works selling at a store of diverse products. Her husband is employed as a lawyer in a court. She has had this business for more than 7 years, and it is located in her house. Her customers are her neighbors and she does not have a set work schedule. She will buy drinks, eggs, basic grains, oil, sugar, bread, candles, etc. at wholesale prices to offer better prices to her customers and to generate more income to help with her family's expenses and to pay off her debt. Maria plans to keep on working to have the needed financial resources to finish her studies and in this way, to have a better future with her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, eggs, basic grains, oil, sugar, bread, candles, etc, at wholesale prices to offer better prices to her customers.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in her place of business. With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 34 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Динары среднее образование, она 16 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. В хозяйстве Динары есть 5 коров, 10 овец. На 0,9 Га арендованной и 1,20 Га собственной земли она выращивает люцерну и ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Динары составляет 7,700 сом(KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 30,000 сом(KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Динара направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Dinara is 34 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. Dinara has a secondary education, and has been raising cattle and growing crops for 16 years. Her entire family helps on the farm. On her farm, Dinara has 5 cows and 10 sheep, and she has .9 hectares of rented land and 1.2 hectares of her own land where she grows alfalfa and barley for sale. Dinara's total monthly income is 7,700 som (KGS). With the goal of increasing her livestock headcount, she has approached "Bai Tushum" Bank for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls for fattening and resale. The income from Dinara's loan will be put toward further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulls for fattening and resale

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: Tareq is a 25-year-old single man who started working as a valet parker a year ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious man who is trying hard to improve his living conditions and continue his studies. Today, Tareq is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his university tuition fees. He hopes to finish his studies and start his own business to build a better independent future.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with three school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth)-selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 42 years old. She is married with five children aged between 10 and 20 years old, and they all go to school. She sells foodstuffs and she has been in a business for 15 years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and local drinks to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings. In the future, she wishes to earns at least 150,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and local juice to sell.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman; she has one child, who attends school. Masika owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Masika operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is a married woman; she has five children, all of whom attend school. Mwanaulu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaulu has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married mother of three children, none of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman who lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and water. 

For the past five years, she has operated an agricultural selling business, selling produce from home to her neighbours and passersby. She also does dairy farming to supplement her income. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak leading to losses of her livestock. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 40,000, she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides for her farming business and gallons for storage of milk for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides for her farming business and gallons for storage of milk for sale

loans.name: Zuura

texts.en:
Zuura is a married mother of seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mtende

texts.en:
Mtende is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mtende operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, and sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother  with two school going children. They live at their own house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (African traditional cloths used like skirts) for resale

loans.name: Dorres

texts.en:
Dorres is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Dorres operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future to help her in transportation of her goods from the market.

With the KES 50,000 loan,  she wants to purchase green vegetables, potatoes, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, potatoes, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, rice, pasta, salt, juice, sodas, water, etc., to have everything she needs to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.name: Mbozde

texts.en:
Mbozde is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
	
She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling meat goat to the community. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats for slaughter for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats for slaughter for resale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a married woman with one child. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, soaps, milk, and other perishable food. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour, milk, and soap for sale to her clients. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour, milk, and soap for sale to her clients

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her school going kids. 

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, her potential customers mostly being ladies. In addition she also operated a retail shop business which is her other source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a hair drier machine and stock of hair braids for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hair drier machine and stock of hair braids for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married woman with three children who still attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a kiosk retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.  

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour, biscuits, and sweets for sale in her business. she decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she will appreciate the support from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour, biscuits, and sweets for sale in her business

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats for slaughter for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats for slaughter for resale

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman and has four kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwaka has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Maria. She is 29 years old, married and blessed with two children. Her economic activity is poultry farming. She also sells charcoal to help supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock to the charcoal business. She has a future plan of opening the charcoal business in the local shopping center and hopes that this will help her achieve her dream of doing the business as wholesale.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva for assisting her in expanding the business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of charcoal to help expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, cyclone fencing, gravel, bricks, and iron to build the wall around his home.

loans.name: Chilembi

texts.en:
Chilembi is a married woman and a mother of seven children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Chilembi is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mwachirimiwa

texts.en:
Mwachirimiwa is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Maita

texts.en:
Maita is a married mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Maita is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married who has no  children. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of transportation and seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (traditional women's wrap cloths) for resale

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling cooking oil, bar soaps, sugar, salts, biscuits, and wheat flour. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operations.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of cooking oil, bar soaps, sugar, salts, biscuits, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cooking oil, bar soaps, sugar, salts, biscuits, and wheat flour

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase a stock of juice and snacks  to add to her business for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a stock of juice and snacks  to add to her business for resale

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling mats to the community . She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operations.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of weaving materials to make mats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of weaving materials to make mats for resale.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity  and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Paula Orbelina

texts.es:
Paula tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su madre, está soltera y tiene una hija pequeña.
 
Paula ayuda a su hermana cuidando de sus hijos desde hace dos años, ella es muy activa en su comunidad y usualmente está involucrada en las actividades de la misma.
 
Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materiales para reparar el techo de su casa, pues se acercan las lluvias y puede ser peligroso para su familia.

Su sueño es que mejoren las condiciones de vida de su familia y por eso se esfuerza trabajando para conseguir todo lo que se proponga.
texts.en:
Paula is 35 years old. She lives with her mother, is single, and has a small daughter.

Paula has been helping her sister take care of her children for the past two years. She is very active in her community and she is usually involved in its activities.

She needs a loan to buy materials to repair the roof of her house, since the rainy season is coming and it can be dangerous for her family.

Her dream is that the living conditions of her family will improve and, for this, she works very hard to get everything that they want.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house, since the rainy season is coming and it can be dangerous for her family.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 34 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, por falta de recursos económicos solo estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltero y vive con sus padres.

José, trabaja como albañil, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace más de 10 años y fue un amigo quien lo incentivo para que lo aprendiera, trabaja todos los días de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. además puede elaborar canastos.

José, solicita el crédito para comprar madera y teja para remodelar el techo de su vivienda, de esta manera mejorara su condición actual.
 
Su principal sueño, es hacer su casa de bloque y formar una familia.
texts.en:
José, age 34, is a very determined person.  Due to a lack of financial resources, he was only able to go to school until the ninth grade. He is single, and he lives with his parents.

José is a bricklayer, work that he has been doing for more than ten years, having been encouraged to learn it by a friend. He works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m., and he is able to make baskets as well.

José is requesting the loan to purchase wood and tile in order to remodel the roof of his home, and in this way, improve its current condition.

His biggest dream is to build his house with cement block and start a family.

loans.use: to purchase wood and tile in order to remodel the roof of his home.

loans.name: Msikiti

texts.en:
Msikiti is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: o purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwihoko Wa Githirioni Women Group

texts.en:
