Mwihoko Wa Githirioni Women Group joined hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013, with the intentions of being trained on group dynamics and financial management and enterprise development.

The woman raising her hand in the photo is Martha, who is one of the members in the group. She is 56 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She practices mixed farming and she is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy feeds for her cows for increased milk production which will increase her income and also enable her to meet her customers' needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds for her cows for increased milk production which will increase her income and also enable her to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Saira Tomasa

texts.es:
Saira, manifiesta que el uso de préstamos ha sido de beneficio para su negocio pues por tal razón su venta de ropa, antojitos y comida continua funcionando y generándole los ingresos que tanto necesita para subsistir con su familia.
Está solicitando nuevamente  un préstamo para poder comprar verduras, granos básicos, bebidas, condimentos, pastas, productos desechables, etc., tendrá a su disposición los ingredientes que utiliza para elaborar su venta y así sus clientes estarán satisfechos.
texts.en:
Saira states that the use of loans has been beneficial for her business since her sale of clothing, snacks and food continues and generates the earnings that she needs to provide subsistence for her family. 

She is applying again for a loan to be able to buy vegetables, basic grains, drinks, condiments, pastries, disposable products, etc. so that she will have the ingredients that she uses to prepare her items for sale and in this way her customers will be satisfied.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, basic grains, drinks, condiments, pastries, disposable products, etc.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, se dispone a programar su próxima siembra de granos básicos y al no contar con un capital suficiente se ha decidido a solicitar un crédito nuevo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el alquiler del terreno en el que realiza sus cultivos, así mismo adquirirá 3 cerdos, esta ayuda le permitirá fortalecer su negocio y continuar trabajando en el campo.
Con el financiamiento anterior aumento el ganado y ha mantenido su negocio vigente, por el momento manifiesta que no ha tenido dificultades para trabajar y que en su familia todos se encuentran muy saludables.
texts.en:
Juan is getting ready to plan his next sowing of basic grain. Because he does not have enough capital, he has decided to request a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay to rent the land where he does his farming. He will also get 3 pigs. This assistance will allow him to strengthen his business and to continue working the land.

With the prior loan, he expanded his livestock and he has kept his business current. At this time, it turns out that he has not had difficulties with working and his family is very healthy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay to rent the land where he does his farming. He will also get 3 pigs.

loans.name: Blanca Etelvina

texts.es:
Blanca de 33 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. 


Blanca tiene experiencia de 16 años trabajando en tienda y en crianza de cerdos, esto lo aprendió por sus padres y por su dedicación, su esposo es quien se involucra y le ayuda en los trabajos que realiza.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materiales y reparar el techo de su casa y también comprará productos para su tienda.

Los sueños de Blanca son ver a sus hijos ser profesionales, y quiere abrir otra tienda en otra comunidad.
texts.en:
Blanca is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children who are studying in the school in her community. 

Blanca has 16 years of experience working in a store, and in raising pigs. She learned this from her parents and because of her dedication. Her husband is the one who is involved now and he helps her with the jobs that she does.

She needs a loan to buy materials to repair the roof of her house and also to buy products for her store.

Blanca’s dreams are to see her children become professionals, and to open another store in a different community.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the roof of her house and also to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water .Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a food cafe in downtown Likoni; she’s had it for more than six years and comments that it’s attained good renown in the neighborhood and thanks to that, she has a good clientele. She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. Mejumaa is asking for this loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, cooking oil and other products to stock her store and have good products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, cooking oil and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy keyboards, monitors, hard disks, CDs, screwdrivers, and computer memory among other pieces necessary to do a good job

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, está necesitando de un nuevo crédito para comprar lijas, pinturas, sierra, etc., para equipar el taller de enderezado y pintura para vehículo, con esta inversión podrá mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
El préstamo anterior le ha sido de beneficio para que su negocio sea más reconocido por la calidad de su trabajo y buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel is in need of a new loan to buy sandpaper, paint, a saw, etc. to equip the workshop of his car body shop. With this investment he will be able to continue his business.

His previous loan benefited him so that his business could become more well-known for the quality of his work and good customer service.

loans.use: to buy sandpaper, paint, a saw, etc. to equip the workshop of his car body shop

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Riziki operates a vegetable stall in the market, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transport to the market. She dreams of expanding her stall and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan, she wants to buy green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for her stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene una hija de un año de edad,  su pareja trabaja en un supermercado, ellas dependen de Luis además de su madre que vive con él.

Luis tiene un negocio de cafetería y venta de antojitos, ya tiene bastante tiempo trabajando en este negocio, comenzó con un chalet y ahora  quiere progresar y aumentar su negocio el cual está cerca de su casa y le es fácil trasladarse.

Él necesita este crédito para invertir en un nuevo local que está remodelando para su cafetería , comprará también herramientas de trabajo y mercadería.

Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio y darle lo necesario a su hija hasta verla convertida en una profesional.
texts.en:
Luis is 35 years old. He studied until the ninth grade. He is in a relationship and has a daughter who is one year old. His partner works in a supermarket. They depend on Luis, in addition to his mother, who lives with him.

Luis has a café and sells snacks. He has spent much time working in this business. He started with a cottage and now he wants to progress and grow his business, which is close to his house and easy to move.

He needs this loan to invest in a new location that he is remodeling for his café, and also to buy work tools and merchandise.

His dream is to see his business grow and to provide her daughter with what she needs so that she can become a professional.

loans.use: to invest in a new location that he is remodeling for his café, and also to buy work tools and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for his son who has entered military school, and to make improvements in his house.

loans.name: Luis Salvador

texts.es:
Luis, tiene una venta de licuados y refrescos, además ofrece el servicio de motorista, el oficio lo heredo de su familia, lo realiza de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, tiene más de cinco años de experiencia y su dificultad es cuando finaliza el año escolar porque las ventas bajan; Luis es acompañado, vive con su pareja y una hija, ambas dependen de él.
Invertirá en frutas, leche, azúcar y canela para elaborar los licuados, también comprara papas, queso, aderezos, pan, etc., para vender nuevos productos en su negocio, espera que sus demandas crezcan y que las ganancias sean mayores para resarcir su deuda.
Luis sueña con tener una vivienda propia para vivir con su familia y poder darles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Luis sells smoothies and soft drinks. He also offers a driving service. He inherited this profession from his family. He works from 7 A.M. to 8 P.M. He has more than five years of experience, and his struggle is when the school year ends, because his sales go down. Luis is in a relationship. He lives with his partner and a daughter. Both of them depend on him.

He will invest in fruits, milk, sugar, and cinnamon to make smoothies. He will also buy potatoes, cheese, seasonings, bread, etc., to sell new products in his business. He hopes that his demand increases and that his earnings become better to pay back his debt.

Luis dreams of having his own home to live with his family and to be able to give them a better future.

loans.use: to invest in fruits, milk, sugar, and cinnamon to make smoothies. He will also buy potatoes, cheese, seasonings, bread, etc., to sell new products in his business.

loans.name: Khuriniso

texts.ru:
Хуринисо замужняя женщина. Ей 40 лет. Она проживает в районе Чиликул. У нее один сын и две дочери. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине, что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране. Старшая дочка работает медсестрой. Сын студент. Младшая дочка учится  в средней школе. 
Хуринисо спокойная и шустрая женщина. Она 5 месяцев назад научила шить и кроить женскую одежду. Хуринисо нравится своя работа. Сейчас Хуринисо хочет начать свой бизнес, но у нее нет денежных средств, чтобы приобрести электронную швейную машинку модели «YAMATA», а также другие швейные принадлежности. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Только Вы можете поддержать Хуринисо и она надеется на Вас. С помощью кредита она будет иметь работу и постоянный доход, что позволит улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Khuriniso is married and 40 years old.  She lives in the Jilikul district.  She has one son and two daughters.  Her husband is currently working in the Russian Federation as a migrant worker because he couldn't find a suitable job in his own country.  Khuriniso's oldest daughter works as a nurse.  Her son is a student.  Her youngest daughter attends secondary school.

Khuriniso is a quiet and smart woman.  Five months ago, she learned how to tailor and sew women's clothes.  She likes her work and would now like to start her own business, but she doesn't have enough money to buy a computerized sewing machine of the "Yamata" brand as well as other sewing supplies.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.  Please support Khuriniso, as she is relying on you.  Thanks to this loan, she will have a job and a stable income, which will help to improve the family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine of the "YAMATA" brand and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 24-year-old single man, the sole breadwinner of five other members of his family. He is a hard worker who started four years ago to work in the construction business, specializing in pasting tiles as the only source of income for him and his family members.

Because his family's living needs are increasing, Abdallah is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy an espresso coffee machine to start his own cafe business to increase his income and develop his family's living conditions.

His dream is to develop his cafe business to expand it to a wide coffee shop and expect more customers in the future.

loans.use: To buy an espresso coffee machine to start his own cafe business to increase his income and develop his family's living

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Fatuma has been operating a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kes 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past two years, selling meat goat at the market. She faces a major challenge of transportation and diseases at her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of goats for slaughter to get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats for slaughter to get meat for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that 10 s neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 10 years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Jover

texts.en:
Jover is a hard-working entrepreneur with five children. She has a small restaurant business in the Philippines and has requested a 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Jover successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her restaurant. She dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman who lives with her husband and five children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 20 years, she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transport. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan, she wants to buy bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es: José tiene 42 años de edad y desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida con su trabajo de albañil independiente el cual realiza desde hace 15 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia ha logrado tener una gran aceptación son sus clientes que cada día son más. Él habita en vivienda propia desde hace 10 años con sus tres hijos 2 de 17 años de edad y uno de 15 años de edad y su esposa que siempre le brinda su apoyo. José desea continuar la construcción de un muro en su vivienda, ya que con el crédito anterior logró construir una parte, pero como se observa en la fotografía aún le falta una parte, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir un muro en su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old, and from a young age, he learned to make a living through his independent construction business. He has been in the trade for 15 years, and thanks to his experience, he has earned a great reputation among his clients. Every day he gains more customers.

For the past 10 years, he has lived in his own home with his three children (two 17-year-olds and one 15-year-old) and his wife who is always supportive.

José wants to continue constructing a wall in his house. With the previous loan he was able to build part of it, but as can be seen in the photo, it is still missing a part. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to finish constructing a wall in his house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to finish building a wall in his house

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who all attend school. She lives in her own house which has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Nuru operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Nuru dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 
	
With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the requested loan of 40,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school . She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past seven years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business.  Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbours especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. She mentioned transportation to her place of operation as a business challenge.

With the requested loan, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy hails from Getafe, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells items ranging from chips, biscuits, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, soap, canned goods and other items.  She is a 31-year-old married woman with three young dependents.

Nancy has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy additional stock like sugar, soft drinks and additional capital for a start-up rtw (ready to wear) business. This will improve the content and display of her store. In these way, her  income will increase and she will be able to start providing her family with a healthy diet. 

She is determined that with the additional capital, she could expand her existing business for a sustainable livelihood and could continue to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like sugar, soft drinks and additional capital for rtw (ready to wear) business.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermín tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en el Distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural donde la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como gallos, pollos, gallinas, cerdos, desde hace más de 5 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor para contribuir con los gastos familiares. Fermín cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mayor precio, con esto el espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fermín is 57 years old and married. He has one son and lives with his family in the district of Oyotún, a rural area where people work in agriculture, business, and ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

For the past five years, he has made a living by raising and selling animals such as chicks, hens, roosters, and pigs. His wife helps him with this work to contribute to covering the family expenses. Fermín enjoys very good personal and professional references in his area.

He has requested a loan to buy more small animals to fatten and sell at a better price. He hopes to offer a better variety of animals to his customers, which will allow him to improve his income level and therefore his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more small animals to fatten and sell at a better price

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.en:
Maria Delia is 62 years old, married and has four children.  

Maria Delia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Delia requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maria Delia has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Delia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: United Women Community Group

texts.en:
The woman on the right is Ruth, 38 years old and a member of this two-person group, United Women Community. She earns an income farming vegetables.

In 2013 Ruth joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from its training, especially in enterprise development and financial management. She is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through HIH EA to buy manure for her fields in order to increase production of kale, cabbages and carrots. Her goal is to increase her income by meeting her customers’ demands for more produce.

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy manure for her fields in order to increase production of kale, cabbages and carrots.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 56 years old, and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to resell.

Visitacion has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from a cafeteria.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees.

For the past ten years Sofia has owned and operated a food stall, selling to neighbors and town dwellers. Her major challenge is transportation from home to her stall.

Sofia is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy ingredients for her trade such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of owning a modern café.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her trade such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norma tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo que vive en Estados Unidos.

Norma tiene experiencia de 20 años trabajando en tienda de granos básicos y productos de primera necesidad, ya que fue fruto del conocimiento y experiencia que adquirió en las tiendas donde se desempeñó anteriormente, además se dedica a la venta de pupusas todos los días de la semana

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más mercadería de primera necesidad y granos básicos, también comprará mesas para la venta de pupusas.

Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para salir a vender sus productos por toda la comunidad.
texts.en:
Norma is 41 years old. She is married and has a son who lives in the United States.

Norma has 20 years of experience working in a store selling basic grains and other essentials. It is the fruit of the knowledge and experience that she gained in the stores where she worked before. She also sells pupusas [stuffed corn tortillas] every day of the week.

She needs the loan to purchase more essential products and basic grains, and to buy tables to sell pupusas.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle to sell her products all around the community.

loans.use: to purchase more essential products and basic grains, and to buy tables to sell pupusas

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, tiene como negocio el cultivo de maíz y frijol, trabaja en el campo con un horario de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, cuanta con 40 años de experiencia, lo aprendió cuando estaba muy joven y ayudaba a sus familiares a realizar los trabajaos de agricultura. José es casado, actualmente vive con su esposa y tres hijos de corta edad, el grupo familiar depende económicamente de él y no posee ayuda económica del extranjero. 
Necesita comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla mejorada para llevar acabo su siembra de maíz y frijol, espera que la cosecha sea abundante para tener alimento para el sustento familiar y para vender el resto, ya que así podrá tener recursos económicos con los que cubrirá otras necesidades familiares.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio, cambiar el estilo de vida familiar por uno más digno y que sus hijos tengan acceso a educación superior.
texts.en:
José grows corn and beans for a living. He works in the country from 6 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon. He has 40 years of experience; he learned when he was very young and helped his family members complete farming tasks.

José is married and currently lives with his wife and three young children. The family depends on him and doesn't have any economic help from abroad.

He needs to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and improved seed to complete the sowing of his corn and beans. He hopes that the harvest will be abundant. Then he will have food to sustain his family and sell the rest, so that he can have economic resources to cover other family necessities.

His dreams are to maintain his business, change his family's style of life to a more dignified one, and that his children will have access to higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and improved seed to complete the sowing of his corn and beans

loans.name: Winifred Wanjiru

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is called Winifred. She is 39 years old, married and a mother of three children.  

She practices dairy farming and is borrowing from Kiva to buy feed for her dairy cows.  This feed will help her increase her milk production and in turn, increase her income to meet her basic needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed to increase milk production which will increase her income to meet her basic needs.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 35-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. 

Her husband owns a small business selling ready-made garments at a shop. He purchases clothes from market at a low price and sells them at a higher price in his community. The town people like his garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather is going to be ending and people are demanding seasonal clothes. 

She requested a loan so that her husband can buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand. 

Zakia wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide a better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase garments for her husband's business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 43 years old and married. She keeps chickens and livestock to earn a living.

Hannah joined Hand In Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from their training, especially in operating and managing her enterprise. She is applying for a 15,000 KES loan to buy poultry feed and mineral supplements in an effort to increase production and earn more money to cover her family's basic needs.

She wishes to express her gratitude to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and mineral supplements for her chickens

loans.name: Edwin Ricardo

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja y su hija, es una persona muy amable con personalidad muy respetada por sus conocidos, trabaja en una organización de agua potable y se desempeña como mensajero y cobrador, él carece de estudios universitarios pues siempre ha tenido que trabajar.

Edwin realiza dicha actividad desde hace 3 años, actividad que aprendió de su tío quien trabajaba en la misma organización, a esta actividad se suma su esposa quien trabaja como secretaria en la misma institución. 
 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse a su lugar de trabajo junto con su esposa,  de esta manera tendrán más tiempo para convivir con su familia, y les será más cómodo y económico viajar en trasporte propio. 


Las metas que el joven  tiene para un futuro son las de cancelar el crédito y adquirir uno nuevo para la compra de un vehículo.
texts.en:
Edwin is 25 years old and lives with his partner and his daughter. He is a very kind person with a personality well-respected by his acquaintances. He works in a drinking water company and serves as a messenger and collection agent. He did not attend college because he has always had to work. 

Edwin has worked at this job for 3 years, which he learned from his uncle who worked at the same company. His wife also works as a secretary in the same institution. 

He needs a loan to buy a motorcycle to travel to his workplace with his wife so that he has more time to spend with his family. They will be more comfortable and it is more economical to travel in their own transportation.

The goals that this young man has for the future are to repay this loan and get another loan for the purchase of a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to travel work with his wife

loans.name: Ergashoi

texts.en: Ergashoi is a capable woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1959. Her childhood was spent in rural areas. She is married and has two children. Ergashoi has 17 years of experience doing business. She trades kid’s clothes in the market. Previously, her daughter and son-in-law helped and supported her to do the business. Now, her daughter raises her children and her son-in–law is working abroad. Ergashoi is responsible, goal oriented and a kind person. Her business is profitable and she likes to do it. She needs money to buy new products for her store and asks for a loan from Kiva lenders. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy kid’s clothes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Fatuma has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kes 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a married mother of four children, none of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Bintimwalimu

texts.en:
Bintimwalimu is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business, where she sells to neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients which causes her good to perish, leading to losses.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase more stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Kitumbua

texts.en:
Kitumbua is a widowed woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kitumbua operates a vegetables stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn, 37, is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. For the past five years she has been working hard operating a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Jonalyn has applied for a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more merchandise for her store, such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. Her aim is to save enough money to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store, such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es:
Dora, vive con sus dos hijas, ambas son dependientes, no cuenta con apoyo económico de familiares en el extranjero, su fuente de ingresos es la crianza y comercialización de ganado, su papá le enseño como realizar dicho negocio y lo está practicando de manera independiente desde hace más de cuatro años.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar vacas lecheras, mejorara su negocio puesto que también tendrá producción de leche con la que elaborara algunos derivados para tener ingresos extras, también espera que al ofrecer este tipo de ganado a sus clientes sus ganancias sean mayores.
El objetivo que tiene la Sra.: Dora es trabajar de manera organizada para que el efecto de la inversión sea positivo y no tenga dificultades para pagar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en: Dora lives with her two daughters. They are both dependent of her, and she doesn't get any economic support from relatives abroad. Her source of income is raising and selling cattle. Her father taught her how to perform the business,  and she has been handling it independently for the past four years. She will use the loan to buy milk cows which will improve her business, since she will have enough milk production to prepare other dairy products to make extra income. She also hopes that by offering this type of cattle to her clients, her earnings will increase. Mrs. Dora's goal is to work in an organized manner so that the effect of the investment will be positive, and she will have no issues paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy milk cows which will improve her business since she will have milk production to prepare other dairy products to make extra income.

loans.name: Elmer Joel

texts.es: Elmer tiene 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 17 años de edad que son su mayor orgullo. Él es  un hombre trabajador que se dedica a elaborar trajes en su sastrería, actividad que realiza desde hace 25 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus servicios.  Elmer desea construir una pila en su vivienda, ya que actualmente no cuenta con un lugar en el cual guardar agua sabiendo que es tan necesaria en un hogar, porque permite que este tenga saneamiento, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila en su vivienda que le permita tener una reserva de agua para el uso de su hogar.
texts.en: Elmer is 47 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children ages 16 and 17 years old. They are his biggest pride. He is a hard working man who works making suits in his tailor shop. He has been performing this activity for the past 25 years, which has given him a large client base who look for his services. Elmer wants to build a water storage basin, in his house. Currently he doesn't have a place to store water, even though he knows how needed this is at home since it allows them to have proper sanitation. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and rebar to build a water storage basin at his house, which will allow him to have a water reserve for his household use.

loans.use: To invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and rebar to build a water storage basin in his house.

loans.name: Shaiyrbek

texts.ru: Шайырбек, 29 лет, женат. Он начал свою деятельность с продажи молодого бычка, позже стал продавать малину со своего сада на местном рынке. Дополнительно Шайырбек занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Благодаря упорному труду в хозяйстве Шайырбека на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы. На участке мерою 0,25 Га он выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход Шайырбека составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Shaiyrbek is 29 years old and married.  He started his own business by selling young bulls, then he began selling raspberries from his own garden at the local market.  In addition, Shaiyrbek is involved in people's transportation.  Thanks to his very hard work, he currently has four cows on his farm.  He also grows potatoes on 0.25 hectare of land.  He makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow his business, he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep.  He is planning to invest the earnings from his loan into further increasing his livestock headcount, so that he can save enough money to repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Al- Shmokh*** Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Shmokh*** and consists of four members who are women who live in Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

In a rented house which lacks of a lot of home appliances, the leader of the group, Iman, lives with her family that consists of six children. She works as a housewife and most of the income of her husband goes to cover the necessary needs of the children and to pay for their house rent. This makes the family live in a miserable condition because of the very limited income of the husband, who is the sole provider of the family. 

Iman applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some used home appliances such as a refrigerator and a washing machine for her house. Taking this loan will create a better standard of living for Iman's family, and the demands of the house will be reduced on her husband and his small salary. By purchasing home appliances, Iman and her husband will furnish the house with the necessary furniture that the house needs.

Iman looks forward to having their own house to save the money that they pay monthly for rent.

loans.use: to purchase some used home appliances such as a refrigerator and washing machine for her house

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 43-year-old married mother of  three children. She has worked from her house as a hairdresser since 2000 to support her husband in developing their family's living and increasing their income.

Dalal decided to start her business at home 15 years ago because she wasn't financially capable of opening a separate hairdressing salon, and at the same time, she had to stay next to her children to take good care of them, and at the same time, financially support them.

Today, Dalal's business is going just fine, but her income isn't enough to cover the increasing school tuition fees; thus, for this reason, her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in paying for her children's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is aged 45 and married to a driver; they're blessed with four children. She has sold vegetables in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 700 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on her hog-raising business to generate additional income. 

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase tomatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, and smoked fish to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, and smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 57 years of age and married with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to access training, especially Enterprise Development and financial management training.

She is a mixed farmer growing potatoes and carrots and also rearing cows. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure which will increase her potato and carrot production, and hence generate more income to meet her basic needs.

Mercy appreciates Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure which will increase her potato and carrot production, and hence generate more income to meet her basic needs.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is the age of 30. She is a mother of three sons living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from his vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables. Therefore, Shagufta requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Shagufta is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's vegetable business

loans.name: Githima Gichiengo Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2013, a group called Githima Gichiengo SHG joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa with the intention of being trained in group dynamics, savings modules, and enterprise development.

Regina, the woman raising her hand in the photo, is one of the members of the group. She is 33 years old, married and a mother of two children.  She practices dairy farming and is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy feed to increase her milk production and sales and get higher income to enable her to take care of her family expenses.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed to increase her milk production and sales and get higher income to enable her to take care of her family expenses.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Morena, es soltera, vive en casa de una hermana con sus dos hijos, el padre de sus hijos le ayuda con una cuota alimenticia mes a mes, sus hijos tiene las edades de 14 y 3 años de edad, el mayor está estudiando, Morena para cubrir otras necesidades de su hogar se dedica vender ropa usada y nueva, hace tres años inicio a vender la mercadería en su vivienda hoy en día cuenta con un puesto en el mercado municipal, no tiene mucha competencia en ese lugar, su horario de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Invertirá en fardos de ropa usada y carteras así podrá cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, considera que son productos con facilidad de comercialización, espera que sus ingresos sean estables y de esa manera poder cubrir las necesidades familiares así como también pagar sus deudas.
Morena aspira incluir otros productos como: calzado, cinchos, artículos para el hogar, etc., para que su negocio sea cada vez más competitivo.
texts.en:
Morena, a single mother, lives in her sister's house with her two children. Their father helps her with a monthly alimony payment. Her children are 14 and 3 years old; the oldest is a student. To cover some household needs Morena sells new and used clothing. She began selling product from her home three years ago, and today she works from a post in the municipal market, where she doesn't have much competition. Her working hours are from 8 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon.

She will invest in bundles of used clothing and purses so she can meet the needs of her customers. Considering that these are easily sold products, she hopes that her income will be stable and she can cover her family needs and pay her debts. Morena hopes to include other products such as footwear, cinches, household items, etc., so that her business will be even more competitive.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing and purses so she can satisfy her customer's desires.

loans.name: Elizbeth

texts.en: Elizbeth is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore Elizbeth has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Elizbeth is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Kayes

texts.en: Kayes is a 23-year-old single man who started working in a stationery shop four years ago to cover his needs and expenses and to pay his university tuition fees. He is an ambitious man and clever student who is trying his best to improve his living conditions, thus today Kayes is acquiring a Youth loan to open a new business selling gifts and toys. This loan is very important to Kayes for it will help him pay his university tuition fees and build a better future.

loans.use: to open a new business selling gifts and toys.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 25-year-old single man, who has been working as a basketball team technical staff member since 2011, and is working hard to develop his future through completing his university studies.

Alaa's income is fine, but not enough to cover both living needs and increasing educational tuition fees. Thus, for this reason he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for his increasing university tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for his increasing university tuition fees.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino tiene 64 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a las labores domésticas.

Gabino se dedica desde hace muchos años al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz, maicillo y frijol actividad que realiza y aprendió de su padre.

Él necesita el crédito para hacer mejoras en su vivienda como reparar el techo y algunas paredes deterioradas.

Sus planes a futuro son terminar de mejorar su vivienda y dar a sus nietos un lugar seguro para vivir.
texts.en:
Gabino is 64 years old and was only able to study up to second grade at school. Gabino has a partner, who does the household chores.

For a number of years, Gabino has grown basic grains, such as corn, sorghum and beans. He learned this trade from – and works with – his father.

Gabino needs this loan in order to make improvements to his home, including repairing the roof and some walls.

In the future, Gabino plans to finish the renovations to his home and give his grandchildren a safe and secure place to live.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home, including repairing the roof and some walls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor and walls of her home.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven con ellos, porque los demás ya tiene sus propias familias.

Marina, se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, pero le ayuda a su esposo para que trabaje en la agricultura y en la compra de ganado, ya que son los trabajos que realizan desde hace cuatro años.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar ganado y otra parte para comprar insumos agrícolas, porque se acerca la época de invierno y es propicia para trabajar con el ganado y los cultivos de granos básicos.

Ella planea en un futuro tener más ganado y obtener mejores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Marina is 42 years old and has a first-grade education. She is married; her husband is a farmer. Marina has five children, only two of whom still live at home while the rest now have their own families.

Marina looks after the household chores but also helps her husband in his farming work and trading cattle. The couple has been doing this work for four years.

Marina will use this loan to buy cattle and farming supplies. Winter is approaching, which brings good conditions for growing basic grains and working with cattle.

In the future, Marina plans to own more cattle and earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle and farming supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 26 years old. She is a widow blessed with two children, aged six and three years old. 

She has had a farming business for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. She has borrowed KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her first loan, to boost her farming business by purchasing animal feeds, animal licks, fertilizer and pesticides. She hopes the anticipated profit will help her to meet her family's basic needs. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well expanded farming business and a more secure market for her farm products, to provide better education for her kids and to enjoy a better life with her kids.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed, animal licks, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Adriana Dulce Maria

texts.en: Adriana previously asked for a credit to build a proper roof and walls for her house. Now that she is able to continue working on her house, she now wants to ask for a second credit to make some aluminum installation on the windows and doors and finish the interior walls. This will help her install proper glass windows instead of just fabric as she currently has and shield her home from temperature changes. She also needs to buy cement and other materials to cover the brick and electric installation is excited about continue making these improvements that make her feel proud of her house. This is just the next step as she says and is interested in having a great track record so she can continue making more improvements in the future.

loans.use: to finish the interior walls and the aluminium installation

loans.name: Sonia Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra es una señora divorciada de su esposo, ya  que comenta que él no le ayudaba con la mantención de sus hijos, Alexandra tiene una hija de14 años, un hijo de 13 años  y el menor de 3 años, su hijo e hija  mayores son muy estudiosos y responsables, el menor aun no está estudiando,   Alexandra va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de una vaca. Alexandra trabaja en una hacienda ganadera y comenta que su patrón le permite tener tres reses que sean de ella, Alexandra tiene la aspiración de mejorar su negocio y comprar el ganado y asi lograr que su negocio mejore y tener los recursos suficientes para las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en: Alexandra is divorced from her husband and she says that he was not helping her look after her children. Alexandra has a 14 year old daughter, a 13 year old son and a small 3 year old. Her older son and daughter are very studious and responsible, the younger child does not study yet. Alexandra will invest the money from the loan in buying a cow. She works on a livestock ranch and her boss is allowing her to have three of her own cows. She hopes to improve her business and buy the livestock. In this way she hopes to improve her business so as to have the necessary resources for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a dedicated and a hardworking dairy farmer from Kebeneti, which is found in the South Rift region of Kenya. He owns a small piece of land which hosts his home and supports his livelihood. Erick keeps dairy animals and grows crops. He is planning to venture into poultry farming where he sees the potential to supply eggs, chicks, chicken and meat at the market. 

To venture into poultry farming, Erick is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy several heads of poultry to start with. Returns from this investment will be used to pay loan, to grow his business and to meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, instilled with a hard-working and adventurous spirit, has been making a living through mixed farming over the past 10 years with a set goal in mind: to be able to get ahead and, together with her family, build a good future. She resides in the Tumeiyo village in western Kenya.

Armed with this conviction, Grace has kept hope and has been toiling on her farm. Her primary sources of income have been milk, poultry, and some “side hustles” she does to supplement the meager income she earns from farming. The Tumeiyo area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a sea of people, but the mill keeps breaking down, so farmers are not able to grind their maize. Grace intends to change this and is requesting a loan to buy an electric posho mill, which will grind corn or maize into flour. 

Maize meal is very common in Tumeiyo village and is a staple food for many communities. Many People living in Tumeiyo Village consume the maize product “ugali“ (hard porridge) regularly. The market usually provides sifted flour, but the cost is higher because of the sifting and packaging. Cheaper flour can be obtained by milling the maize directly using a posho mill. 

Through this loan, Grace will be able to grind maize faster because she will use an electric posho mill. Cases of breakdown will be history because electric posho mills are more reliable. This loan will help Grace to change her life and achieve her life's mission of bringing economic development and poverty alleviation to communities in arid and semi-arid areas. Profits from the posho mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan, which Grace promises to fully repay on time. In the next two years, Grace sees herself as an established businesswoman who will be running more than one posho mill in her remote village. Grace patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an electric posho mill.

loans.name: Murod

texts.en:
Murod is a handsome man and comes from a family of workers. He is a bright, capable, hardworking and kind person. He was born in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. He is married and his wife works in agriculture. Murod is a welder and knows his trade well. He has five years of experience doing business. He is qualified and has lot of satisfied clients. Murod is the family's keeper and works hard to earn money to cover the family's needs. 

However, he lives in a village and has bad living conditions. As the head of his family, he needs to do what he can to provide for them. In the village where he lives, it is not easy to find a good job and feed a family, but Murod tries to do his best. He asks Kiva lenders for a loan to buy construction supplies so he can renovate his house. He hopes to improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies so he can renovate his house.

loans.name: Abiyéma

texts.fr: Abiyéma est une femme mariée et âgée de 36 ans vit à Adidogomé avec ses cinq enfants. Abiyéma s’évertue de mettre à disposition de son ménage sa contribution pour son épanouissement. C’est en cela qu’elle prépare des ignames frites et des spaghettis dans son quartier et trouve une satisfaction du profit qu’elle tire. Abiyéma s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci de répondre aux besoins de ses consommateurs, Abiyéma nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des ignames et des spaghettis afin de bien faire sa friture
texts.en:
Abiyéma is 36 years old, married, and lives in Adidogomé with her five children. She strives to help her family develop.
For this reason she prepares fried yams and spaghetti in her local area. She is satisfied with her profits.

Abiyéma procures her ingredients twice a month at a market. In order to respond to her customer's needs and better conduct her business, she needs a loan to buy yams and spaghetti.

loans.use: to buy 4 lots of yams and eight cartons of spaghetti

loans.name: Mounira

texts.fr: Mounira vit à Attiégou et est âgée de 41 ans. Mounira est une femme mariée avec quatre personnes à charge. Mounira vend de la bouillie préparée à base du mil, du maïs et du haricot dans le quartier et arrive à vendre grâce à son dynamisme. Mounira s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter quelque sac de mil, de maïs et du haricot, Mounira demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer le profit nécessaire pour aider son mari dans les diverses charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Mounira lives in Attiégou and is 41 years old. She is married and takes care of four people. She works selling bouillie [porridge] made from millet, corn, and beans in a local area. She is able to make her sales thanks to her dynamism. 

Mounira procures her ingredients twice a month at a market. She is seeking this loan in order to buy millet, corn, and beans so that she can earn the necessary profits to help her husband take care of the various family expenses.

loans.use: to buy one sac of millet, one sac of corn, and one sac of beans

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 22 ans, Adjo est une femme mariée qui vit avec un enfant à Adidogomé. Pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille, Adjo vend des pagnes tissés qu’elle expose au marché et dans le quartier. Adjo réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des pièces de pagne, Adjo demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjo is 22 years old, married, and lives with a child in Adidogomé. In order to encourage her family's development, Adjo sells pagne [bright, colorful] fabric from a market and in her local area. She is able to make a profit with this business.

She procures her goods twice a month from a market. Adjo is seeking funds so that she can buy more pagne fabric and earn some profits. These profits will help her to better take care of her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy seven lengths of pagne [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une femme mariée de 34 ans et très entreprenante. Ama vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants et travaille activement pour leur fournir une bonne éducation. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Ama vend des produits de beauté et des pagnes dans son quartier pour trouver le revenu leur permettant de couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Ama s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des produits répondant mieux à la volonté de ses clients, Ama demande ce crédit pour commander des savons défrisants afin d’augmenter son profit et aider son mari à éduquer les enfants
texts.en:
Ama is 34 years old and married. She is very entrepreneurial. She lives in Adidogomé with her two children and actively works so that they have access to a good eduction. For this reason, Ama works selling beauty products and pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] in the local area. She is able to earn enough to cover the everyday expenses.

Ama procures her goods four times a month at a market. She is seeking this loan so that she can order more goods that better respond to her customer's wishes. She is is going to buy hair straightener in order to earn profits and help her husband to provide for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy three dozen hair straighteners

loans.name: Palenque Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario es mixto, conformado por un hombre y tres mujeres emprendedores (Wilmor René, Loty, Erika Johana y Marcia) de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son hombres y mujeres que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de: Ropa usada, pulpería y repostería. Se organizaron como grupo solidario recientemente para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana.

Loty: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Palenque, es una joven cordial de 22 años de edad,  con cualidad es de líder, casada con un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como operador en una empresa. Con el objetivo de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y aportar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 2 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Chiverías, granos básicos, entre otros productos y así incrementar sus ingresos.  Ella sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is mixed, comprised of entrepreneurs, a man and three women (Wilmor René, Loty, Erika Johana, and Marcia), of Miskita ethnicity from Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are men and women who work each day with determination to achieve the growth of their little businesses of used clothing, general store and a pastry shop. They recently formed themselves as a solidarity group to get a Pana Pana loan. 

Loty is the coordinator of the Palenque solidarity group. She is a friendly young woman, 22 year sold, with leadership qualities. She is married with a 2-year-old child. Her husband works as an employee at a business. With the goal of having her own income and supporting the household expenses, 2 years ago she established a small general store in the outdoor walkway of her stilt house made of wood. She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise: snacks, basic grains, and other products, and in this way increase her income. She dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise: snacks, basic grains and more.

loans.name: Mirian Marlene

texts.es:
En el Cantón El Carmen su principal ingreso económico  es por el cultivo de  plátano, cacao, maracuyá, yuca y otros productos de ciclo corto. La zona es reconocida por el ecoturismo y la riqueza de su flora y fauna, goza de paisajes naturales extraordinarios,  esta zona goza de un exquisito clima tropical. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mirian, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos de 24, 22, 19, 20, 17 y 10 años los mismos que 4 son independientes y dos estudian en el colegio y en la escuela. El cónyuge es comerciante de frutas. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Mirian tiene un puesto en el mercado  de la ciudad de Pedernales en la que vende frutas y verduras. Trabaja todos los días desde las  07h00 hasta las 17h00, ella se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado a comprar los mejores productos para poder ofrecerles el mejor producto a sus clientes, trabaja en compañía de su esposo  y tienen este negocio ya por 25  años, a pesar de que el trabajo es sacrificado tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar  frutas y verduras, (manzanas, peras, bananos, zanahorias, papas, choclos, cebollas entre otros). Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace seis años  y le gusta porque es muy unido el grupo. Su meta es comprar un local para un comedor en pedernales ya que le gusta la gastronomía.
texts.en:
In the El Carmen district, the main source of income comes from farming bananas, cacao, passion fruit, yucca and other short-cycle crops. The area is recognised for its ecotourism, the richness of its flora and fauna, and an abundance of extraordinary natural scenery. This area boasts a superb tropical climate. 

This is where Mirian lives. She is 45 years old and has a life partner with whom she has six children who are 24, 22, 20, 19, 17 and 10. Four of them are no longer dependent and two are still studying at school.

Her partner sells fruit and vegetables. He works every day from 7am until 5pm and she sets off to the market early in the morning in order to buy the best products to offer their customers. 

She works in her partner's company, which he has owned for 25 years. His job is tough but he has to do it for the wellbeing of his family. 

She plans to use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables (apples, pears, bananas, carrots, potatoes, corn and onions etc). She has been part of the loan group for the past 6 years and she likes it because the group is very close-knit. 

Her goal is to buy a premises to set up a cafeteria in Perdenales because she loves cooking.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Gasparin Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Gasparin, está integrado por tres mujeres (Gretel, Beksi y Amalia) todas de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Las tres venden mariscos y pescados de manera ambulante y en las paradas de buses. Es un grupo solidario que se organizó hace 9 meses, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos con Pana Pana, con el propósito de tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Gracias al primer crédito que recibió de Pana Pana con financiamiento de KIVA, les permitió a cada una cumplir con sus objetivos y así comenzar a mejorar sus ingresos y resolver algunas necesidades básicas en sus hogares.

 Amalia: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer cordial, casada con 6 hijos que estudian su pre-escolar, primaria y secundaria. Su esposo se encuentra desempleado. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 2 años vende mariscos y pescados. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar sus productos vender refrescos y chiverías en su vivienda de tambo de madera. Ella sueña con crecer más y establecer una pulpería donde genere más ganancia; que le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The Gasparin solidarity group is made up of three women (Gretel, Beksi, and Amalia), all of Miskita ethnicity from Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. The three sell shellfish and fish as street vendors and at the bus stops. It is a solidarity group that was organized 9 months ago, with the goal to work in solidarity to access Pana Pana loans, with the goal of having the opportunity to improve their small businesses. Thanks to the first loan that they got from Pana Pana, with financing from Kiva, it permitted each one to meet her goals and in this way begin to improve their income and meet some basic needs in their households. 

Amalia is a member of the solidarity group. She is a friendly woman, married, with 6 children who go to school in preschool, primary and secondary school.  Her husband is unemployed. With the goal of getting her family ahead and supporting the household expenses and her children's education, for 2 years she has sold shellfish and fish. She asks for a loan to diversify her products to sell soft drinks and snacks in her stilt home made of wood. She dreams of growing more and establishing a general store where she can generate more earnings, which will permit her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to diversify her products to sell soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Febrero Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está integrado por 3 mujeres luchadoras ( Ivania, Maricela y Aurelia) de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Es un grupo nuevo que se conformo hace unas semanas, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios de: Pulpería, venta de cosméticos y productos de bellezas, venta de frito, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Ivania: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Febrero, con cualidades de líder, es una joven alegre de 25 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 6 años de edad estudia su primer grado de primaria y un pequeño de un año de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como buzo. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 5 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, sopas instantáneas, pan, huevo, entre otros productos. Su sueño es diversificar sus productos, vender carne molida, embutidos, gaseosas.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 determined women (Ivania, Maricela, and Aurelia) of Miskita ethnicity from Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. It is a new group that was established a few weeks ago, with the goal of working together to be able to access Pana Pana loans, which will allow them to increase the inventory of their small businesses of a general store, cosmetics and beauty product sales, and fried food sales, increase their income, and in this way improve their families' living conditions little by little. 

Ivania is the coordinator of the solidarity group Febrero, with leadership qualities. She is a happy young woman, 25 years old, and is married with two children. The older one is 6 and is in first grade in the primary school and the little one is one year old. Her husband works informally as a diver. With the goal of supporting the household expenses and her children's education, 5 years ago she established a small general store in the  outdoor walkway of her house. She asks for her first loan to purchase basic grains, snacks, instant soups, bread, eggs, and other products. Her dream is to diversify her products, sell ground meat, cold cuts, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snacks, instant soups, bread, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Umon

texts.en:
Umon was born in the western part of Tajikistan in 1962. He is married and has one child. He lives in a rural area called Urmetan. Urmetan is a small village where no women are doing business. Only the man is a feeder and keeper of a family and considered head of the family.  

Umon has many years of experience doing business. He is a driver and knows well his activity. He loves his work and drives his car with pleasure. He earns enough money from his activity and spends for family needs. He is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to repair his car. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: Lenin Michel

texts.es:
En el Cantón El Carmen su principal ingreso económico  es por el cultivo de  plátano, cacao, maracuyá, yuca y otros productos de ciclo corto. La zona es reconocida por el ecoturismo y la riqueza de su flora y fauna, goza de paisajes naturales extraordinarios,  esta zona goza de un exquisito clima tropical. 
En este lugar vive el señor Lenin,  tiene 40 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen una  hija de 15  años que estudia en el  colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa. Vienen en  casa propia. 
Don Lenin es un hombre trabajador, es empleado en una empresa que se encarga de realizar el tratamiento de purificar el agua para que sea apta al consumo humano y embotellado del mismo, aquí tiene trabajando 23 años, su horario de trabajo es de 7h15 hasta las 17h30 de lunes a viernes.
Este crédito lo va a invertir una parte en gastos médicos de su hija que se encuentra delicada de salud y en, mejorar su vivienda. En el grupo de crédito tiene un año y medio, lo invito su cuñada a ser parte del grupo y le está agradecido, le gusta el grupo que es unido y de la fundación que los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos documentos. Su sueño es tener solvencia económica siempre y que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
In the El Carmen Canton, the main income comes from the cultivation of bananas, cocoa, passion fruit, yucca, and other short-cycle produce. The area is known for the ecotourism and the riches of its flora and fauna. It enjoys extraordinary natural scenery and an exquisite tropical climate.

Lenin lives here, is 40 years old, is married and from this relationship has a 15 year old daughter that goes to high school. His wife is a housewife. They live in their own home. Lenin is a working man, an employee in a business that is responsible for the treatment of purifying water to make it suitable for human consumption and bottling it. He has been working here for 23 years. His work schedule is from 7:15AM until 5:30PM, Monday to Friday. 

He will invest part of this loan in his daughter's medical expenses, who is in poor health, and in improving his house. He has been in the loan group for a year and a half. His sister-in-law invited him to be part of the group and he is thankful to her. He likes that the group is united and from the Foundation, and that the loans are quick and without lots of documents. His dream is to have financial solvency provided that his daughter is a professional.

loans.use: with his daughter's medical expenses and improving his house.

loans.name: Karen Lizeth

texts.es:
En el Cantón El Carmen su principal ingreso económico  es por el cultivo de  plátano, cacao, maracuyá, yuca y otros productos de ciclo corto. La zona es reconocida por el ecoturismo y la riqueza de su flora y fauna, goza de paisajes naturales extraordinarios, esta zona goza de un exquisito clima tropical. 
En este lugar vive la señorita Karen, tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera. Vive con sus padres.
Doña Karen es secretaria en una flota de buses, su horario de trabajo es pasando un día, se encarga de hacer los despacho de los buses y por cada despacho le pagan; también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos en su casa con la ayuda de sus padres,  ella compra  cerdos para criarlos y luego faenarlos,  vende la carne por libras,  lleva algún tiempo dedicada a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cerdos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos. Está en el grupo hace año y medio y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho los créditos. Su sueñoes tener casa propia.
texts.en:
In El Carmen canton, the primary income is from growing plantains, cocoa, passionfruit, yucca and other products with a short growing season. The zone is well-known for ecotourism and the richness of its flora and fauna. It has extraordinary natural landscapes, and this zone has an exquisite tropical climate. 
 
Karen lives in this place. She is 20 years old and single. She lives with her parents.

Karen is a secretary in a bus fleet. Her work schedule is spending the day in charge of dispatching the buses and for each dispatch they pay her. She also works raising pigs at home with the help of her parents. She purchases the pigs to raise them and then butcher them. She sells the meat by weight. She has been doing this work for some time and it has gone fairly well for her and is a way to earn something from her house. 

This new loan will be used to purchase pigs, and feed and medicine for them. She has been in the group for a year and a half and is very happy because the loans have helped her a lot. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Lina Bellamira

texts.es:
En el Cantón El Carmen su principal ingreso económico  es por el cultivo de  plátano, cacao, maracuyá, yuca y otros productos de ciclo corto. La zona es reconocida por el ecoturismo y la riqueza de su flora y fauna, goza de paisajes naturales extraordinarios,  esta zona goza de un exquisito clima tropical. 
En este lugar vive la señora, Lina tiene 64 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El cónyuge es chofer y viven en casa propia.
Doña Lina se dedica a la cría de aves de corral en una pequeña granja en su casa, cría pollos y patos con la ayuda de dos hijos, los tiene de dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa. Le ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa.
Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar semillas de cacao para sembrar y así tener otro ingreso extra. Es socia desde que empezó el grupo De Crédito, está muy agradecida con la fundación y con el grupo  que es muy solidario y trabajan para salir adelante.
