Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan un trabajo estable y no pasen por dificultades económicas, y lo principal que ella no se enferme ya que cada vez que se enferma gasta mucho dinero.
texts.en:
In El Carmen canton, the primary income is from growing plantains, cocoa, passionfruit, yucca and other products with a short growing season. The zone is well-known for ecotourism and the richness of its flora and fauna. It has extraordinary natural landscapes, and this zone has an exquisite tropical climate. 

Lina lives in this place. She is 64 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has seven adult children who are independent. Her spouse is a driver and they live in their own house. 

Lina works raising poultry in a small farm at her house. She raises chickens and turkeys with the help of two children, she has them for two to three months  which is the time for them to become ready for sale. After this time, she brings them to some stores in the area or also sells them by weight and live to businesspeople who come to her house. It has gone fairly well and is a way of earning something from her house. 

This new loan will be used to purchase cocoa seeds to plant and in this way have extra income. She has been a member since the communal bank group began. She is very grateful to the foundation and to the group which is very close and works to get ahead. Her dream is that her children have stable work and don't experience economic difficulties, and most importantly that she doesn't get sick since each time she gets sick, she has to spend a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa seeds.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 61 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Flora has a buy and sell feeds business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Flora requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of feeds to resell.

In the future, Flora would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of feeds to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some repairs to her house.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a seasoned horticultural farmer from the rain-fed Kericho area of Kenya. He grows crops and keeps poultry. 

His 2015 plan is to expand his agri-business and grow his asset base. To do that, he needs to grow more bananas and raise more hens, something that requires a lot of dedication, time and resources. 

Lucas is a committed full-time farmer. He needs a loan of KES 60,000 to buy more poultry and pay for inputs involved in planting of more bananas.
 
Lucas will use the income from this investment to service the loan and take care of the financial needs of his family.

loans.use: to grow bananas and purchase poultry.

loans.name: Fernando De Jesus

texts.es:
Fernando se ha dedicado a la carpintería gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando como empleado en algunas carpinterías y ebanisterías donde aprendió a realizar la actividad. 

Fernando al ver que su negocio estaba muy mal remunerado decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller de carpintería donde gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha podido tener una gran cantidad de clientes. 

Trabaja solo durante 4 horas todos los días.
Fernando se encuentra soltero y vive con su madre, a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de progreso. 

Debido a que tiene dificultades de capital, Fernando ha tenido que rechazar algunos pedidos de sus clientes por la poca capacidad para conseguir las materias primas necesarias. 

Con el ánimo de mejorar esta condición, Fernando aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una canteadora.

Fernando aspira que el préstamo le permita elaborar estos pedidos sin que se afecten sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Fernando began working in carpenters' and cabinetmakers' workshops when he was very young, learned these trades, and has worked in them most of his life. Realizing that he could good earn a good living as a carpenter and cabinetmaker, Fernando decided to go into business himself and set up his own workshop. He's built up a broad and strong customer base over the years, consisting of people who appreciate the high quality of his work. 

Fernando works half a day, four hours, every day. He is single and lives with his mother, who always worked to provide Fernando a better life and more opportunities to improve that life himself.  

Fernando lacks capital, and he's had to turn down some orders that customers wanted to place because he didn't have the raw materials required for those jobs. To avoid this problem in the future, Fernando hopes to apply for a loan so that he can purchase an edge banding machine. He's hopeful that this loan will allow him to fulfill customer orders while maintaining his monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase an edge banding machine for his cabinetmaking workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the needed beads and nylons.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy, aged 40, is married to an OFW (overseas Filipino worker) and they're blessed with two children. 

He has owned and operated a transportation business for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. His profits in his business usually are spent on purchasing a supply of hog feeds for his hog-raising business, to have an additional income. 

Due to insufficient capital from his business, he would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. He's hoping that his business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Rochie

texts.en:
Rochie is 35 years old, married, and has three children, who all attend school. Rochie works very hard to provide for them.

Rochie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and other groceries.
 
Rochie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future Rochie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fredy Arturo

texts.es:
Fredy, invirtió el financiamiento anterior en mejorar el inventario de la venta de cosméticos y de artículos de uso personal, su núcleo familiar es el mismo y sus ingresos han incrementado un poco.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar lociones, cremas corporales, champoos, pastas dentales, etc., para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y tener ingresos para disminuir las necesidades famialires.
texts.en:
Fredy invested the previous loan in improving his inventory of cosmetics and products for personal use. His nuclear family is the same and his income has increased a little.

He is asking for another loan to purchase lotions, body creams, shampoos, toothpaste, etc. to meet his customers' demand and have income to reduce family needs.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, body creams, shampoos, toothpaste, etc. to meet his customers' demand and have income to reduce family needs.

loans.name: Muguga Ecosystem Research Community Forest Association (Mercfa) Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Joyce. She is 54 years old, married and living with three of her children. 

She practices poultry and dairy farming and she is borrowing from Kiva to buy chicken feeds and dairy feeds to increase her production and income, which will enable her to feed her family, provide good clothing for her children and also pay their school fees.

Joyce is much grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy chicken feeds and dairy feeds to increase her production and income, which will enable her to feed her family.

loans.name: Irma Lucia

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo con quien tiene un hijo, ella como madre protectora lo cuida día y noche, pero a la vez en sus ratos libres se dedica a realizar trabajaos de decoración desde la comodidad de su casa.
Ella adopto dicha profesión porque es algo que había hecho desde el colegio y con su trabajo puede generar recursos para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar y no sentirse como una persona mantenida.
Con la ayuda de un préstamo que quiere invertir en artículos de decoración como papeles de todo tipo y de colores, icopor, tijeras, pegamento.
Este préstamo será el comienzo de un progreso, ella aspira a convertir su negocio informal en algo constituido con local propio y con muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Irma, 27, lives with her husband.  They have a child whom she, as a mother, takes care of night and day.  At the same time, in her free time she makes decorations in the comfort of her home.

Irma took up this profession because it's something she has done since school.  With this job she's able to earn income to help with the household expenses and to feel independent.

With the help of the loan she wants to invest in supplies for decorations such as all types and colors of paper, polystyrene, scissors, and glue.

This loan will be the start of an improvement.  She hopes to convert her informal business into something official with her own sales space and a lot of orders.

loans.use: to buy a variety of paper and models to make her beautiful party decorations and home decorations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a store and purchase rice, beans, sugar, bread and other basic grocery items.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 23 años es soltera, tiene un hijo de seis años que se encuentra bajo su cuidado, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela con el afán de darle lo mejor a su hijo se dedica a la compra y venta de cortes típico de su región este negocio lo realiza desde hace tres años, pero esta admirable madre de familia para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a la crianza de pollos y cultivo de banano, café, ella cuenta que gracias a estas actividades logra sacar adelante a su familia.
Manuela ahora tiene la gran oportunidad de comprar media cuerda de terreno para  poder construir su casa, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar esta compra, por tal razón ella solicita un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para aprovechar la oportunidad.
El gran sueño de Manuela es poder comprar su terreno y así poder construir su casa de terraza.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 23-year-old woman, single, has a 6-year-old child in her care, and lives in a community of Sololá.

Manuela, with the desire to give her son the best, works buying and selling traditional clothing from her region. She has done this business for three years, but this admirable mother, to improve her income, also works raising chickens and growing bananas and coffee. She says that thanks to this work, she manages to get her family ahead. 

Manuela now has the great opportunity to purchase a plot of land to be able to build a house, but one of the difficulties that she has is not having sufficient money to be able to make this purchase. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of Q 10,000.00 to take advantage of the opportunity. 

Manuela's greatest dream is to be able to purchase her land and in this way be able to build her house with a terrace.

loans.use: to purchase land for future construction.

loans.name: Leidy Katerin

texts.es:
Leidy es una bella joven de 24 años de edad que atiende un negocio de venta de acolchados desde el año 2012, tiene un hijo de dos años, trabaja no solo para mantener a su familia, por pagar sus estudios, por superarse, por ser productiva y gracias a este negocio a su hijo nunca le ha faltado la leche para alimentarlo.
Inicio su trabajo por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, con la meta clara de que iba a ser exitosa pues quería mejorar su vivienda y bueno ahora que su venta de toallas, ropa bebe, cortinas, tendidos, sabanas esta más constituida y saben que se encuentra en ese sitio, quiere explorar otra alternativa para ofertar en su negocio y esto sería la venta de:
•	Gafas de sol
•	Joyería en acero
•	Lociones
Por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar estanterías y surtido variado de los productos anteriormente mencionados y con los que espera potenciar y consolidar definitivamente su negocio.
texts.en:
Leidy is a pretty young woman, 24 years old, who has had a business selling cushions since 2012. She has a 2-year-old child, and works not only to support her family, but to to pay for education, to improve herself, to be productive and thanks to this business, her child never lacks milk to drink. 

She began her work for enjoyment and vocation to work independently, with the clear goal that she would be successful since she wanted to improve her house and now that her sales of towels, baby clothing, curtains, bedding, and sheets is more established and they know where to find her in this place, she wants to explore other alternatives to offer in her business and this would be the sale of:

•	sunglasses
•	steel jewelry
•	lotions

For this, she asks for a loan to purchase shelving and a varied assortment of the previously mentioned products and with those she hopes to strengthen and definitively establish her business.

loans.use: to begin to sell steel jewelry, sun glasses and lotions.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four school-aged children. 

Due to bad financial conditions, Sawsan and her husband cooperate together to fulfill their family needs and live in a good way. She decided to start her own job and she opened a clothing shop in 2013, where she offers a great variety of used clothes at good prices. 

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and therefore her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities like canned goods, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, beverages and soap. She is a 57-year-old married woman with three grown children. She hails from Getafe, Bohol. She has been running a store for quite a few years now.

She is asking for a loan to purchase items like canned goods, soft drinks, and several liters of gasoline. These will help improve the display of her store and attract more buyers to shop and purchase. In this way, her income will grow and she will be able to handle her finances. 

With the additional capital, she will now be able to expand her business for a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items like canned goods, soft drinks, and several liters of gasoline.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, a 35-year-old woman, has given her entire life in service to her family, trying to get them ahead and together overcoming the obstacles that have come up against them in life. 

Thanks to her mixed farm, she has generated the income needed to support her children. Hellen has been a farmer for as long as she has been a wife. She operates on a small piece of land under her husband's name, keeping dairy and poultry and growing crops and trees. 

Hellen is seeking a small loan of KES 30,000 to pay for farm implements. Working with modern tools will make her work move faster and become more efficient. She expects to see major improvements in the quality and quantity of yields through the use of improved tools.

loans.use: To buy farm implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and bricks, and to pay for labor to build a wall in his house

loans.name: Antonio Paz

texts.es:
Antonio de 71 años de edad, estudió 2° grado, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos está en el extranjero y los otros dos viven en casa pero no dependen de Antonio.

Antonio tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 6 años, vende productos de primera necesidad y no tiene que salir de casa, en su tiempo libre trabaja en agricultura, también sus hijos aportan para los gastos del hogar, su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa y de esa manera se ayudan para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar arroz, azúcar, bebidas, etc. para surtir su tienda y comprará fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.

Él sueña con construir una cocina y tener más espacio para su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio, 71, studied up to second grade.  He's married and has three children, one of whom is abroad.  The other two live at home but are not dependent on Antonio.

Antonio has had a small store for six years.  He sells staple items without having to leave home.  In his free time he works in agriculture.  His children also help with the household expenses.  His wife is a homemaker, and that's how they help each other get ahead.

Antonio needs this loan to buy rice, sugar, beverages, and so on to stock his store.  He's also going to buy fertilizer to grow corn and beans.

He dreams of building a kitchen and having more space for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beverages, and so on to stock his store, and fertilizer to grow corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the construction of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 49-year-old married woman with six children, three attend school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Rebecca has had a fish vending business for 15 years and  requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

 In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Haydee

texts.es:
Mirna, está preparando todo para llevar a cabo los cultivos de maíz y plátano, por lo que se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abono, semilla mejorada y pagara los trabajaos de preparación del terreno.
Con el préstamo anterior ha mejorado mucho su negocio, teniendo recursos económicos para ir cubriendo las necesidades familiares y disminuir sus deudas.
texts.en: Mirna is preparing everything for her corn and banana crops. That is why she decided to ask for a new loan to buy fertilizers, manure, improved seed varieties, and to pay for labor to prepare the terrain. Her last loan helped her to improve her business greatly, having economic resources to cover for her household needs and to reduce her debts.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, improved seed varieties and to pay for labor to prepare the terrain.

loans.name: Doris

texts.fr: Doris est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans. Habitant à Adidogomé, Doris  est une commerçante de bijoux qui parcoure tout le quartier pour livrer les produits à ses clients. Son activité lui procure un résultat qu’elle ménage pour couvrir les charges de la famille. Doris s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Doris demande ce crédit pour lancer une nouvelle commande de bijoux complets pour vendre et réaliser encore plus de bénéfices pour venir en aide aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Doris is a married woman of 44. Living in Adidogomé, Doris  sells costume jewelry, moving everywhere around the neighborhood to deliver her goods to her customers. Her activity brings in income that she doles out to cover the family's living expenses.

 Doris stocks up twice a month in the market. She is requesting this loan to be able to place a new order for sets of jewelry for resale so that she can make more profit  to use to help out with the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy four dozen sets of costume jewelry

loans.name: Igorora Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Igorora Tutungukye Group is located in a trading center 3 km away from Ibanda town. The group is comprised of only women who mostly deal in small scale businesses.

Doreen is a married woman with six children of whom four are in school. Two dropped out due to lack of means to pay tuition. Doreen sells roasted bananas (Gonja) on the road. She runs her business with a working capital of UGX 300,000. She requested a loan of UGX 600,000  to add to her working capital so as to increase her cash flow. She will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children and buy them a few basic needs. 

Doreen's customers are passengers  who stop over for something to eat. Her major challenge is harsh weather conditions like sunshine and rain which affect her during her business operations since she has to sit by the roadside waiting for her customers.

Despite all these challenges, Doreen is a very hard-working woman who is striving to provide a good education and a good standard of living for her children.

loans.use: To buy raw plantains to roast and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  beehives.

loans.name: José Fausto

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya tienen su propia familia y viven aparte, en su casa vive solo con su esposa.

José trabaja en la agricultura, desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado a este oficio, el trabajo queda cerca de su casa, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y sus hijos los apoyan económicamente siempre que pueden.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para el cultivo de maíz y frijol y para pagar una deuda pendiente.

José sueña con seguir trabajando y emprender algún negocio propio.
texts.en:
José, 64, was not able to study. He is married and has 3 children who now have their own families and live on their own. 

He lives in his house with only his wife. 

José has worked in agriculture for the past 15 years. His work is close to his home. His wife takes care of the house and his children support them economically whenever they can. 

He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, to pay for day labor to grow corn and beans and to pay off a debt. 

José dreams of being able to keep working and to start his own business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay for day labor to grow corn and beans and to pay off a debt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy feed and more chickens to help boost farming.

loans.name: Mahsatoi

texts.en:
Mahsatoi is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. For about eight years, she has been busy with honey buying and selling. 

She is married and has four children. Her husband is missing. It was hard for her to raise her children without her husband. She is supported by her son and daughter. 

Mahsatoi has many years of practice of trading honey. She buys from rural areas and sells in the city and nearby districts. She has permanent clients and is satisfied to do business with honey. 

Mahsatoi is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy honey and enlarge her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy honey

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is a 34-year-old married woman with three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has had a rice retail business for several years. This is the source of her income. She  earns an additional income selling pineapples. 

Airene will use the loan to buy more rice and pineapples. Airene believes that a loan will help her to improve her business and income. Aireen dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive in the future.She wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy rice and pineapples.

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza is a sari-sari store owner from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is 55 years old and operates her sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Leoniza has been in the business for several years now. 

Leoniza would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits and others. A loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Leoniza has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits and others

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a fifty-six-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to pay for labor and buy seeds. 

He has farmed for 14 years and  has a retail shop to meet his family's daily expenses. Wild animals and fluctuating prices  are his greatest challenges. His dream is to become a model farmer and construct a permanent house. Deo intends to use the loan to  buy bricks, cement, and sand to build his house.

loans.use: to  buy bricks, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Marcaribe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (María Elena, María y Emely) todas son de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de: Pulpería, venta de bastimentos y ropa usada. Se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace 6 meses para gestionar préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Con el primer crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le permitió  a Maria, integrante del grupo solidario incrementar su inventario de frutas y verduras, diversificar sus productos. Actualmente vende frijoles cocidos.

Emely: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven amable de 19 de años de edad, con deseos de superación, casada con un pequeño hijo de 4 años. Su esposo trabaja como chofer de un taxi. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde  hace 2 años estableció una pequeña tienda de ropa usada, en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de Bilwi, de esta manera apoya con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada mixta y venderla a precios accesible a su clientela y así incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda de ropa nueva y calzado.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three women (María Elena, María, and Emely).  All of them are of Miskita ethnicity from the city of Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality.  They are enterprising women who struggle day to day to make their small businesses grow.  Their businesses are a grocery store, selling supplies, and selling used clothes.  Six months ago they organized into a group in order to manage to get a loan with a group guarantee from Pana Pana .

The first loan granted by Pana Pana and Kiva allowed Maria, a member of the communal bank, to increase her inventory of fruits and vegetables and to diversify her products.  She now sells cooked beans.

Emely, a member of the communal bank, is an amiable 19 year old young woman.  She has the desire to improve herself.  She is married and has a little four year old son.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  With the intention of having her own source of income, she established a small store selling used clothes two years ago.  It is in a spot that she has at one of the Bilwi markets.  This way she helps with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy a bundle of mixed used clothes in Managua.  She will sell the clothes at affordable prices and increase her earnings in this way.  She dreams of establishing a new clothes and shoe store.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of mixed used clothes in Managua.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is a 36-year-old, hardworking woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a hotel (primitive restaurant) as her main source of income, a business she started with an intention of generating funds and meeting family demands. 

She also practices farming, where she grows coffee to earn extra income. She hopes to own a well-known hotel in the future; however, she faces a main challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand.

She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of rice, beans and other items to cook and sell in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, beans and other items to cook and sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Marietou's Group

texts.fr: Mariétou est assise au deuxième rang au bout à droite et porte un joli foulard tenant sa pochette de myAgro en mains. Elle est membre d'un groupe de 18 productrices agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Farababougou, au sud-est de Bamako(Mali).Mariétou est âgée de 45 ans et vit dans une famille composée de 9 enfants. La fourchette d'âge de ses enfants va de 11 à 30 ans. Mariétou dit qu'elle ne connaît pas d'autres activités que l'agriculture car elle assure l'autosuffisance alimentaire et qu'il y a possibilité de vendre les excédents de produits pour se faire fortune. Elle a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour son système de paiement petit-à-petit et l'accès aux intrants. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Mariétou a acheté un paquet de semences et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champ de 0.0625 hectare. A travers cet achat, Mariétou espère avoir plus de rendements afin d'élever des chèvres. Mariétou affirme qu'elle lui manque des matériels agricoles( charrue à bœufs)car elle dit, je cite: " Si les hommes n'ont pas fini de labourer, ils ne laboureront pas pour nous (les femmes)".
texts.en:
Mariétou is sitting in the second row at the end on the right, wearing a pretty scarf and holding her myAgro passbook in her hands. She is a member of a group of 18 women farmers who work and live in the village of Farababougou, southeast of Bamako (Mali). Mariétou is 45 and lives in a family comprising nine children. The split in ages of her children extends from 11 to 30 years. 

Mariétou says she knows no other business than agriculture since she ensures their self-sufficiency in foodstuffs and can maybe sell excess products to make some income. She decided to register for myAgro because of its system of incremental payment and its access to farm inputs. 

For her first year with myAgro,  Mariétou bought a package of seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts (groundnuts) on her field measuring 0.0625 hectare. Through this purchase, Mariétou hopes to have more yield so as to be able to raise goats. Mariétou shares that she lacks farming implements (a plow pulled by oxen) since she says, "If the men have not finished plowing, they won't plow for us (women)."

loans.use: to buy a packet of seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Pylis

texts.en:
Phylis is married and blessed with six children.

 Her  raises poultry and dairy cows. She also grows maize, beans, and vegetable. She will use the loan to buy poultry feed. She feels that the loan will assist the business by increasing chicken and eggs production. She looks forward to improved income and customer demand.

Phylis is very grateful to Kiva for assisting her to expand the business

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Romila

texts.en:
Romila is a native of Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells goods like sugar, cooking oil, coffee, noodles, canned goods, seasonings and toiletries. She is a married woman with a young dependent. It has been one year now that she has been engaged in this kind of business.

She has requested a loan to buy assorted items like canned goods and other merchandise. These stocks will fill her store and could attract more buyers to purchase. In this way, her income will improve and she can start to manage her finances. She could then expand her business and able to set aside some savings for emergency  purposes.

loans.use: to buy assorted items like canned goods and other merchandise

loans.name: Samar Group

texts.en:
Ola is the featured borrower for Samar Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and lives at the same time.

Ola is a 29-year-old single lady who has been working as a hairdresser from her house since six years ago to cover her needs and expenses. She is an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business; thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools which will facilitate her work and satisfy her customers' needs. Ola is the second lady on the right of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Hiyam is the first lady on the right, Rania is the second lady on the left, and Samira is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools which will facilitate her work and satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Edna who is a veteran of a thousand battles survived over the length of her life. She is a mixed farmer from the remote village of Tumeiyo. At the age of 35 years, she is a proud owner of a farm, where she plants maize and vegetables and keeps dairy cows. 

Edna practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm, and knowledge attained from the agricultural training she has undergone with Juhudi Kilimo. Edna also operates a side hustle business to supplement the meager income she earns. Edna's sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg-selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that she faces is delivering to the market on time. 

The Eldoret area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. That is why Edna is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, she will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

Edna is determined to succeed. Because she is very disciplined with finances, she plans that through accumulated profits, she will be able to provide a secure future for herself, and also for her ageing parents. Edna’s dream is to be financially empowered. Edna’s greatest yearning is to succeed with her dairy farming and be able to have the best economic opportunities in her household to progress together with her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use to deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She earns a living through a hog-raising business.  

Evangeline has been in the business for more than 18 years now. As of this time, she needs a loan for her business. Evangeline is requesting to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. Evangeline believes that a loan will help her improve her business, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a thirty-six-year-old hardworking divorced woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a retail and produce shop as her main source of income. She started this business with the intention of educating her children and improving on her standards of living. She also earns extra income from growing coffee. 

Mildred hopes to educate her two children and own a sustainable business though she is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand.
 
She is requesting a loan to buy more coffee, beans, millet and other items for sale.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, beans, millet and other items for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a thirty-four-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop as his main source of income which business he started because it was profitable. He also earns extra income from being a farmer. He hopes to increase his profits. However, he faces a major challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand and cover the high rate of defaulters. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more general merchandise like crates of soda, sugar, salt, soap and others to sell during the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy more general merchandise like crates of soda, sugar, salt, soap and others to sell during the Easter season.

loans.name: Digna Liliana

texts.es: Liliana esta cruzando por los 27 años de edad, Liliana esta casada y tiene un hijo de 3 años y una hija de 11 años, los 2 están estudiando, el esposo de Liliana se dedica a la agricultura sembrando pequeños huertos de los productos propios de su localidad, Liliana necesita el dinero del crédito para la compra de fungicidas y abonos para tener sanos a sus cultivos, Liliana es una señora muy trabajadora que tiene la aspiración de mejorar su negocio y por medio de este en algun momento comprarse una casita y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Liliana, 27, is married and has a 3 year old son and an 11 year old daughter. They both go to school. 

Her husband works in agriculture growing small gardens with the native crops from the area. 

Liliana is requesting a loan to buy fungicides and fertilizer in order to grow healthy crops. 

Liliana is very hard working and aspires to improve her business in order to at some point, buy a little house and improve the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Expedito

texts.en:
Expedito is a forty-nine-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a tailoring workshop as his main source of income which business he started to generate funds and increase his monthly savings. He also earns extra income from farming. He hopes to buy a motorcycle, however he faces a main challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand.

He is requesting a loan to buy raw materials (cloth) to use for making suits in his tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (cloth) to use for making suits in his tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses deux enfants à Adidogomé. Adjo est âgée de 29 ans et vend de la bouillie préparée à base du maïs dans son quartier et des beignets pour l’accompagner. Adjo s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché pour disposer son stock. Pour commander quelques sacs de farine et de maïs, Adjo demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et gagner plus de bénéfice pour venir en aide aux diverses charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjo is a married woman who lives with her two children in Adidogomé. Adjo is 29 and sells porridge made of maize in her neighborhood, accompanied by fritters. She stocks up four times a month at the market so as to have her ingredients on  hand. 

To be able to order some sacks of flour and maize, Adjo is asking for this loan to cover her purchase and earn more profit so that she can help out with the various family expenses.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of maize and three sacks of wheat flour

loans.name: Ana Karina

texts.es: Ana es una jovencita alegre con su vida, tiene 18 años de edad, Ana comenta que vive con sus abuelitos, Ana  ingreso a la universidad y comenta que ella se dedica a la crianza animales menores para asi obtener ingresos y apoyarse en los gastos de estudio, el abuelito de Ana es quien le apoya con algo de dinero para pagar la universidad, Ana  va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de pollos para  tenerlos en un lugar que hay en la casa de su abuelo, la mas grande aspiración de  Ana es continuar en sus estudios y cumplir sus sueño de llegar a ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Ana is a happy teenager. She is 18 and lives with her grandparents. 

She is attending college and raises small animals in order to have an income to help with her college expenses. 

Her grandfather pays for her tuition. 

Ana will use the loan to buy chickens. She will keep them in a place at her grandfathers house. 

Her biggest dream is to keep studying and to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Sali's Group

texts.fr: Sali, au centre  sur la photo et portant un vêtement noir, est membre d'un groupe de 7 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Bancoumana, au sud-ouest de Bamako, au Mali.Sali, qui est âgée de 51 ans,a 13 enfants, huit filles et cinq garçons, qui sont tous scolarisés.L’agriculture lui permet  d'éviter la faim et la misère. Elle a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour avoir des engrais de bonnes qualité et afin de payer progressivement les intrants agricoles. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Sali a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide. À travers cet achat, Sali espère avoir un meilleur rendement pour gagner plus d'argent afin de pouvoir avoir des fonds supplémentaires pour couvrir les frais scolaires de ses enfants, mais aussi pour acheter une pompe à moteur pour son potager.
texts.en: Sali, who is in the centre of the photo and wearing black, is a member of a group of seven farmers who live and work in the village of Bancoumana, south west of Bamako in Mali. Sali is 51 years old and has 13 children, eight girls and five boys, who are all educated. Farming allows her to avoid hunger and misery. She decided to register with myAgro so that she could get good-quality fertilizers and pay bit by bit for farming inputs. In her first year with myAgro, Sali has bought a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer to farm groundnut. Through this purchase, Sali hopes to make a better yield and earn more money, so she can have extra funds to cover her children's school fees, but also so she can by a motor pump for her vegetable patch.

loans.use: to buy OPV seeds and fertilizer for farming groundnut.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth; she is 57 years old and has eight children. Elizabeth  is a small-scale farmer practicing dairy and vegetable farming,  which she has been able to manage and expand after Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training where she has acquired skills on savings, enterprise development, and has improved her financial management skills.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed that will help improve milk production. This will help meet the demand for milk in Limuru thus bring in more income to cater for family needs.

  Elizabeth  is happy for Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed that will help boost farming thus bring in more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Itomboya Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Peter. He is a member of Itomboya Self Help Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training on savings, enterprise development and financial management.

Peter is 46 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a small-scale farmer practicing dairy and vegetable farming, and he also operates a cafe. He is borrowing a  Kiva loan to boost his small-scale farm by buying hybrid vegetable seeds. He believes that this will give him more returns and provide for the basic needs for the family, especially food, school fees and clothing for the children.

He is grateful for the Kiva lenders for the support, and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy hybrid vegetable seeds that will help improve  the farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person in the photo is called Jane; she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training on enterprise management. 

Jane is married and blessed with three children. She is a small-scale, mixed farmer of potatoes and sukumawiki (kale), and she keeps two dairy cows. She wants a loan to boost her vegetable farming by buying fertilizer and manure. She believes that this will improve the returns on the business, and hence, provide better education for the children and basic needs for the family.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure that will help improve the farm, and thus, bring more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a a 21-year-old, single man from a village near Qalqilia city. His father works as an employee in a local company. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Ahmad is a student in the university, where he studies business administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
Zaynura is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1985. She is living in a small town. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an engineer. 

She does a business of sewing traditional women's dresses. She sews attractive and beautiful dresses and has permanent clients. Her sister supports and helps with her business. She sews at home. 

She needs to buy textiles, thread, bids, etc., for sewing. Zaynura requests a loan from Kiva lenders to buy needed materials and widen her business. She awaits your mercy and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy textiles and thread

loans.name: Condormocco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CONDORMOCCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca, la socia continua dedicándose al  negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo platanos, mandarinas, papayas y naranjas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono, semillas entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de café, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Communal Bank “Condormocco”, which is located in the District of Echarate in La Convencion Province, Department of Cusco. 

One of the members is Francisca. She continues to work at her business of selling fruit. She has been in this business for years and it is going very well thanks to the hard work she puts into the business every day. 

She sells bananas, tangerines, papayas, and oranges. This is how she supports her family. Francisca is requesting a loan in order to buy items such as seeds and fertilizers. 

The other members engage in businesses such as selling coffee, selling fruit, managing a grocery store, and selling food. 

Francisca is grateful to those who helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy items such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 32-year-old, hardworking, married woman with two children aged 10 and 3 years living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a shop of fresh foods as her main source of income, which she started with an intention of educating her children and improving her standards of living. She also earns extra income from basket making. 

She hopes to construct a permanent house, but her main challenge is inadequate capital. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fresh foods and materials for making baskets.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods and materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Jose Vladimir

texts.es:
José es un amante de los números y le encanta ser bastante cuidadoso con el cuido del dinero, lo que le guió para estudiar su licenciatura en Contabilidad Pública y Auditoria. A sus 20 años de edad, este joven optimista ya termino su carrera y ha llevado varios cursos, pues o se cansa de aprender eso que tanto le gusta.
Este joven enérgico siempre ha contado con el apoyo de sus padres para seguir profesionalizándose. Su papá, que es maestro de obra, siempre lo ha impulsado a seguir por sus sueños, por lo que para él esa ha sido un gran motor para continuar. Después de tantos estudios solo falta un paso para salir a buscar un trabajo estable. Por esta razón, José solicita un préstamo para poder pagar su título y convertiste en un Lic. en Contabilidad y Auditoría oficialmente. En sus metas está terminar sus cursos de inglés y estudiar otra carrera relacionada a la suya.
texts.en:
José is a  lover of numbers and he likes to take care of money, which is what lead to him studying a degree in public accounting and auditing. At 20 years old, this optimistic young man has already ended his career and has taken several courses, since he is getting tired of learning that which he likes so much.

This young, energetic man has always replied on the support of his parents in order to continue developing his professional career. His father, who is a master of arts, has always encouraged him to follow his dreams, which has always been a great motive for him to continue. After so much studying the only missing step is for him to go out and find a stable job. For this reason, José is looking for a loan in order to be able to pay for his degree and become an official accounting and auditing graduate. Amongst his goals, is to complete his English courses and to study another related degree.

loans.use: To pay for his degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell during the Easter season.

loans.name: Lucia Luz

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijos menores. Su familia es unida, viven en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas y patos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo se utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Lucia espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucia is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and young children. The family has remained together and lives in a community where people work in commerce and farm or raise livestock. It is located in Zaña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

She earns her living raising and selling small animals such as hens and ducks, running this business from her house. She has 5 years experience in this business and regular clients that provide excellent work and personal references for her. 

She will use this loan to buy more animals as well as balanced feed to raise them. In this way Lucia hopes to offer her clients a larger variety of animals, which will have a positive effect on her level of income, and in the end improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals as well as balanced feed to raise them.

loans.name: Mitzy Rociel

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Mitzy es una pequeña muestra de lo excelente que se siente estudiando lo que la apasiona. Los números y las finanzas son el día a día de esta joven de tan solo 19 años de edad, puesto que estudia el quinto año de la licenciatura en banca y finanzas. El apoyo incondicional de su madre, quien es profesora, la ha ayudado a sentirse motivada para tener sus estudios y estar hasta donde está ahora. 
Ahora que Mitzy está en su último año de la carrea universitaria, solo le falta un paso para convertirse en una licenciada. Razón suficiente para solicitar un préstamo para pagar el título y ser llamada oficialmente Licenciada en Banca y Finanzas. Último paso le permitirá facilitarle la búsqueda de trabajo. En un futuro sueña estudiar un posgrado para seguir aprendiendo.
texts.en:
Mitzy's smile is a small sample of how great she feels to study what she loves. Numbers and finance are the day to day of this young woman who is only 19 years old, since she is studying in the fifth year of her banking and finance degree. The unconditional support of her mother, who is a teacher, has helped her to feel motivated to carry out her studies and to be where she is at the moment. 

Now that Mitzy is in the last year of her university degree, the only missing step is for her to become a graduate. This is a sufficient reason for her to ask for a loan in order to pay for the degree and for her to officially be called a graduate in banking and finance. This last step will allow her to search for work. In the future she hopes to study a postgraduate degree in order to continue learning.

loans.use: to pay for her degree.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée Afi vit à Adidogomé avec ses trois enfants. Afi est âgée de 37 ans et est très active pour la prospérité de sa famille. Ainsi pour contribuer à la survie de son foyer, Afi vend de la pate de cosette préparée. Afi alimente ses clients en parcourant le quartier afin de réaliser ses gains. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de cosette, Afi nécessite ce crédit pour faire ses achats afin d’avoir un bénéfice pour investir dans la vie éducative de ses enfants.
texts.en: Afi is married and lives in Adidogomé with her three children. She is 37 years old and is actively working so that her family may prosper. In order to contribute to the survival of her household, she sells dough made out of sugar beet chips. She supplies her customers on a door-to-door basis in her neighborhood so she can make a profit. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Afi needs this loan so she can order and pay for sacks of sugar beet chips and make enough profit to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of sugar beet chips.

loans.name: Gogo

texts.fr: Gogo vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 36 ans. Mariée, Gogo est  mère de trois enfants et très active pour favoriser leur éducation. Gogo vend des céréales  dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Gogo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de haricot et de tapioca, Gogo demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire pour permettre l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Gogo lives in Adidogomé and is 36 years old. She is mother to three children and is very active so she can support their education. Gogo sells cereals in her neighborhood so she can have enough income to provide for them. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. She is requesting this loan so she can buy bowls of beans and tapioca and make enough money to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 60 bowls of beans and 73 bowls of tapioca.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Etant une femme au foyer et âgée de 51 ans, Adjovi vit avec ses sept enfants dans le quartier d’Attiégou. Adjovi vend de la farine, de la pate du maïs et de manioc écrasé pour ainsi subvenir aux besoins du foyer. Adjovi s’approvisionne au marché une fois par mois. Adjovi est dynamique et a une bonne rentabilité dans son activité génératrice de revenu. Adjovi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter quelque sac de maïs, de manioc et des bols de farine afin de réaliser encore plus de bénéfice.
texts.en: Adjovi is a housewife who is 51 years old, and she lives with her seven children in the Attiégou district. She sells flour, corn dough and crushed cassava so that she can provide for the household's needs. Adjovi gets her supplies once a month from the market. She is dynamic and makes good money from her income-generating activity. She is requesting this loan to buy several sacks of corn, cassava and bowls of flour, so she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy one sack of corn, two sacks of cassave and five bowls of flour.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person on the photograph is Grace; she is aged 57 years, and she is married. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to get knowledge from the training, especially the enterprise development training.

She practices dairy farming, and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy cattle lick salt to increase milk production and be able to meet her customers' demand and earn more income.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to buy cattle lick salt to increase milk production, be able to meet her customers' demand and earn income.

loans.name: Gituamba Abc Women Group

texts.en:
Gituamba ABc Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 with the intentions of being trained in group dynamics, financial management and enterprise development.

The lady raising her hand in the photo is Sophia. She is one of the members of the group who is 29 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She practices dairy farming and she is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy feed for her cows to increase her milk sales, and therefore be able to meet her customers' needs and also pay for her family's basic needs.

Sophia is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed for her cows to increase her milk sales

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 38-year-old married man with two children aged ten and six years old respectively. Together with his family, they live in Getafe, Bohol.

Victor operates a tricycle transport service.  A tricycle is a vehicle similar to a bicycle, but having three wheels, two at the back and one at the front. 

Victor is asking for a loan to purchase a tire, spare parts, and to pay for registration and a permit. These materials are very important in the operation of his livelihood. His trip will be hassle-free and he could transport passengers on time without delay. In this way, his income will improve and he will be able to manage his business successfully.

Victor hopes that he could set aside some savings to purchase another tricycle unit.

loans.use: to purchase a tire, spare parts, and to pay for registration and a permit

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is a 21-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. His father works as an employee in a local company. This is the only source of income for the family.

Naji is a student in the university, where he studies business administration. He wants to complete his study and find a job in the future to improve the family’s living conditions.

Naji took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Naji appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Chepngeno

texts.en:
Chepngeno (with her husband in the background of the photo) is 23. She is a progressive, smallholder farmer from a very remote village in the Litein region of Kenya. Chepngeno is primarily in dairy, but also cultivates crops across the steep contours of the mountainous landscapes of the area. 

Chepngeno is seeking a small loan from Kiva lenders to finance the cultivation of more crops on her farm in the coming season. Initial loan repayments toward this loan will come from the dairy income until the crop yields are ready for market. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: to finance the cultivation of more crops

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. She is a 47-year-old woman with two children, ages 21 and 7 years old, respectively. She also engages in a food-vending business. She sells barbecue and snack foods like rice cakes. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 10 years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and supplies like meat products for her barbecue business. These will help improve the yield of her farm. Her  barbecue business will start to be augmented. She could now handle her business properly.

With this loan, she could expand both her businesses for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm and supplies like meat products for her barbecue business

loans.name: Luisa Rafaela

texts.es:
Las condiciones higiénicas son importantes para mantener una vida saludable y cómoda. Sin embargo, en algunos sectores del país no se cuenta con estos servicios y es por ello que la microfinanciera Mi Crédito, en su labor de mejorar las condiciones de vida de esas familias, ofrece este tipo de financiamientos. 

Por ello, la señora Luisa solicita un crédito para la construcción de un sanitario, que le ayudará a mejorar las condiciones higiénicas de su casa.  Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora, pues se dedica a la confección de ropa para ayudar a la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Hygienic conditions are important for maintaining a healthy and comfortable life. Nevertheless, in some sectors of the country, one can't count on these services and that is why the micro-finance institution Mi Credito, in its efforts to improve the conditions of life for these families, offers this type of financing.

For that purpose, Luisa is requesting a loan, to construct a bathroom that will help her to improve hygienic conditions in her house. She is a hard-working, responsible and enterprising woman, who is dedicated to making clothing to help improve her household economy.

loans.use: to construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Blanco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Tatiana Dianiris, Loira Manuel y Daysi), viven en Bilwi; Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se unieron hace 2 años, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para ir incrementando sus pequeños negocios de venta de productos de: Pulpería, venta de bastimentos y mariscos, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.
Con el primer crédito financiado por PANA PANA y otorgado por KIVA, le permitió a LOIRA integrante del grupo solidario pagar el salario a sus trabajadores e incrementar su inventario de mariscos.

Daysi: Es integrante del grupo solidario BLANCO, es una mujer cordial de 36 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como Albañil. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 2 años vende chiverías, refrescos, fritos en la salida de una escuela pública de Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para diversificar sus productos vender en su vivienda mariscos y pescados, así incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es tener un tramo.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of 3 enterprising women (Tatiana Dianiris, Loria and Daysi), they live in Bilwi in the city of Puerto Cabezas. They came together 2 years ago in order to gain access financing by means of credit in order to increase their small business selling various products: groceries, supplies, and seafood. This was in order to increase their incomes to be able to cover the basic needs of their homes, to ensure the education of their children and to improve their homes. 
The first loan financed by PANA PANA and given by Kiva, allowed Loria to pay her workers wages and to increase her seafood inventory. 

Daysi is a member of the solidarity group Blanco, she is a friendly, 36 year old woman, whos is married with 6 children who study in primary and secondary school. Her partner works informally as a bricklayer. 
With the intention of having her own source of income and contributing to the household expenses and education of her children, she has sold chiverias (yoghurt desserts), soda, and fries outside a public school in Bilwi for 2 years. She is asking for financing in order to diversify the fish and seafood products which she sells from home, to increase her income. Her dream is to have plot to do this.

loans.use: to diversify their products and to sell sea food and fish

loans.name: Ines Carolina

texts.es:
Actualmente, Inés se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, al mismo tiempo, estudia su último año de contabilidad pública y auditoria.  Porque ella tiene presente que para aspirar a un mejor futuro, se debe preparar como profesional, esto a la vez, le dará la pauta para ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijas.  
Por ello, solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos del curso de graduación y para cubrir los trámites del mismo. Lo que le será beneficioso porque podrá iniciar su vida laboral en el área que estudió y en consiguiente esto le generara mayores ingresos económicos. Además, la potenciará como profesional de éxito.
texts.en:
At the moment Inés sells cosmetics, and at the same time she is studying her final year of public accounting and auditing. 
Because she has aspiration of a better future, she must prepare herself professionally, at the same time this will give her guideline in order to provide a better future to her children. 
Therefore, she is asking for a loan to pay for the costs of her graduation course. It will be beneficial to her because she will be able to start working in the area in which she studied, consequently this will generate her more income. In addition, it will enhance her as a successful professional.

loans.use: To pay for a graduation course

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en:
Naboth is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce growing and selling as his main source of income. He started the business because it was profitable and he wanted to increase his household income. He also earns extra income from a bar.

He hopes to become a prominent businessman, though he is limited by lack of enough capital to meet the increasing demands and the seasonality changes affecting his profit margin.

He is requesting a loan to buy building materials to complete his latrine.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete his latrine.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 27-year-old, hardworking, married man with three children, aged 6, 4 and 2 years. He is living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices livestock as his main source of income, alongside farming. He started this business so as to look after his family and educate his children. He hopes to become a modernized farmer; however, his main challenge is inadequate capital.
 
He is requesting a loan to buy more cows and goats for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats for his farm.

loans.name: Azucena Virginia

texts.es: Azucena esta en la edad de 38 años, tiene 3 hijos  de 6, 14 y 16 años de edad, el esposo de Azucena trabajo de guardia de seguridad, Azucena se dedica a la venta de productos de tienda ya que su  negocio lo tiene  desde hace 4 años, Azucena dice que su negocio esta bien ubicado y  logra tener buenas ventas, Azucena trata con  mucha amabilidad a sus clientes, Azucena necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar mercadería de productos  de tienda, Azucena tiene la aspiración de seguir adelante en su negocio y con las ganancias es que puede dar la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Azucena is 38 years old and has three children who are 6, 14 and 16 years old. Azucena’s husband works as a security guard and Azucena sells products in a store. Her business has been functioning for 4 years now. 

Azucena says her business has a good location and she has good sales. Azucena is very courteous with her clients.

Azucena needs the money from this loan to buy products to sell in her store. Azucena hopes to continue with her business and with the money she earns pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ndengelika Small Business Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Ndengelika Small Business Self Help Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training.

The group has been trained on good savings habits, which has assisted them to embrace the savings culture. Also, this has assisted them start up businesses which are now doing well. The group is also involved in activities such as table banking and merry-go-round.

The person holding the passbook in the photo is Samuel. He is married and blessed with four children. He does farming of maize, beans and vegetables and also does dairy farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feeds to help boost milk production. He appreciates Kiva for the financial intervention, since he is able to take care of his family needs.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds that will boost milk production, and thus, add more income to meet family needs.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old, married and has two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings, especially on enterprise development.  

He practices vegetable farming, and he is borrowing the loan to buy more seedlings to add to his vegetable farm for more income.

John is happy about Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings to add to his vegetable farm for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Cecile Georgine

texts.fr:
Cécile est femme courageuse de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et a élevé 8 enfants dans la campagne sur les hauts plateaux de Madagascar. La famille élève des zébus et des cochons depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle va ensuite les vendre au marché aux zébus de la commune Urbaine d’Antsirabe ( à une dizaine de kilomètres de son domicile) qui a lieu une fois par semaine le samedi. L’élevage est une sorte d’héritage et de tradition familiale qui se transmet de génération en génération.

Le partenariat avec Vahatra a débuté il y a 4 ans et lui a permis d’augmenter progressivement son cheptel. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle a déjà pu acheter un terrain qui lui permet de cultiver des légumes et ainsi de pouvoir compléter, par sa propre récolte, les besoins alimentaires de sa grande famille. 

Son objectif est de réussir à être entièrement autonome tout en garantissant la sécurité matérielle de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Cécile is a courageous woman who is 55 years old. She is married and has raised eight children in the countryside on Madagascar's high plains. The family has been raising Zebu cattle and pigs for more than 20 years. She sells them afterwards at the Zebu market in the urban commune of Antsirabe (around ten kilometers from her house)  which takes place once a week on a Saturday. Cattle raising is a sort of heritage and family tradition which passes from one generation to another.

The partnership with Vahatra began four years ago and has allowed her gradually to increase her livestock. With the profits from her activity she has already been able to buy a piece of land, which allows her to grow vegetable and thus supplement, with her own harvest, her large family's nutritional needs.

Her objective is to succeed in becoming entirely autonomous, while at the same time guaranteeing the material secuirity of all her family.

loans.use: to buy a bull and a pig.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 26-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small, humble house. Ibrahim works in a store selling mobile phones. He is also a student in a local university, where he studies business administration.

Ibrahim took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. This will help him to do his homework and write reports easily.

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 34-year-old divorced man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small humble house. He works as an employee in the public sector. He is also a student in a local university where he studies business administration.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to do his homework and write reports easily.

Mohmmad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es: Maria de 47 años vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su nieto, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas desde hace 14 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, tomates, repollos, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, aged 47, lives in her own house with her two children and one grandchild. 

She has prepared and sold pupusas for 14 years. She does this from her home, and has many customers, especially her neighbors. With the earnings from her sales, she is able to cover some of the household costs. 

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, cheese, shredded pork, beans, tomatoes, cabbage etc. all wholesale, too be able to continue with her work and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, shredded pork, beans, tomatoes, cabbage etc. all wholesale

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: Maria de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 10 años, su negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de carnes, pollos, arroz, frutas, verduras, refrescos y demás ingredientes para seguir con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria, 36, lives in her own home with her husband.  She's had a business selling food for 10 years.  Her business is located in a very busy spot; this is why she has many customers.  With the income she earns from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  

Maria is requesting a loan to buy meat, chicken, rice, fruit, vegetables, drinks, and other products so that she can continue with her work and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy food for her business

loans.name: Hermenegilda Isabel

texts.es: Hermenegilda de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un molino de nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que venden tortillas pues ahí van a moler el maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de chuchillas, discos y fajas para los molinos y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda, 49, lives in her own home with her family.  She's had a nixtamal mill located in her house for 2 years.  She has a lot of customers, especially the women who sell tortillas, because they go to her to grind their corn.  With her earnings from her sales, Hermenegilda is getting ahead.  

Hermenegilda is requesting a loan to buy blades, discs, and belts for the mill.  This way, she can continue with her work so that she can have greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy parts to maintain her mill

loans.name: Fanohat

texts.en:
Fanohat is a cook. She was born in a small town in 1954. She is married and has five children. She has 10 years' practice of doing her business of serving people with hot, delicious meals. 

She rents a canteen and likes this activity to cook. She has permanent, satisfied clients every day. It is a family business, and her children and husband are helping to do the business. 

She needs to refresh her canteen and attract more clients. It is nice to sit in a clear and beautiful place and eat. Fanohat is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to renovate her canteen. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to renovate a canteen

loans.name: Nirina

texts.fr:
Nirina est une jeune femme dynamique de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et a 2 petits garçons. La famille vit avec la sœur de Nirina qui l’aide pour garder ses enfants lorsque le couple est au travail. Nirina tient une petite épicerie dans le grand marché de la commune Urbaine d’Antsirabe.

Cela fait 5 ans qu’elle a démarré sa propre activité et 3 ans qu’elle est partenaire chez Vahatra. Elle vend essentiellement des produits de première nécessité tels que de l’huile, des pâtes, du sucre, du riz et des gâteaux. Elle souhaite, avec ce prêt, continuer à augmenter son stock de marchandises et étendre son activité à d’autres types de produits tels que les crédits téléphoniques (cartes prépayées) et autres accessoires de téléphones (batterie, chargeur…).

Dotée d’un fort esprit d’initiative, cette jeune mère de famille se fixe comme objectif de consolider son capital pour étendre encore son activité et devenir à terme grossiste. Parallèlement à cela, elle  espère surtout pouvoir un jour construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Nirina is a dynamic 28-year old woman, who is married with two small boys. The family lives with Nirina's sister, who helps out by looking after her children while the couple is working. Nirina has a small grocery in the Grand Market in the urban commune of Antsirabe.

She began her own business five years ago and she has been a partner of Vahatra for the past three years. She mainly sells basic food products, such as oil, pasta, sugar, rice and cakes. With this loan she would like to continue increasing her stock of goods and expand her business to other types of product such as prepaid telephone cards and other telephone accessories (batteries, chargers..).

This young mother enjoys a strong sense of initiative, and her aim is to consolidate her capital and continue expanding her business and ultimately become a wholesaler. At the same time, she is hoping above all to be able to build her own house one day.

loans.use: to buy a stock of basic products such as oil, flour and salt.

loans.name: Evaristo Florentino

texts.es:
Evaristo es un hombre de 47 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos varones de 18 y 10 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 16 y 4 años, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Él es emprendedor, buen padre, decidido, fuerte, responsable y trabajador.
